She has been doing this for one year. Lanuola has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, chemicals, a hose, and a wheel barrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Lanuola hopes to earn more profits to help her business and her kids' educations.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seed, fertilizers, chemicals, a hose, and a wheel barrow.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is married with three children and she has a buy and sell business to add to her husband's income. After a year of selling different kinds of goods like RTW, blankets, and pillow cases, Cheryl is earning well for her family. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to replenish her stock of blankets and pillow cases to resell. She hopes to gain more income to supplement her family's needs. She wants to have a better standard of living in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more products like blanket and pillow cases to resell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza has been earning from her farm and transportation businesses and was able to repay her previous loans from GDMPC successfully. She used her previous loan to improve the farm. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to resell. She wants to improve her business because with it, she earns a daily income. With her determination and effort, Liza is hopeful that she will become successful in the future and able to provide a better living for the family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 56 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rebecca has a business selling newspapers in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more newspapers to sell.

Rebecca has been in this business for six years. Rebecca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more newspapers to sell

loans.name: Maricela Abigail

texts.es:
Maricela, es soltera, no tiene hijos, vive en casa familiar, para apoyar con los gastos familiares y cubrir sus necesidades personales, inicio por cuenta propia la venta de ropa y variedad de fruta, su jornada es de 8:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m., ya tiene experiencia en administrar su negocio.
Efectuará la compra de ropa, surtida en colores, estilos y tallas, para  caballeros, damas y niños, con lo que tendrá mejores opciones de compra para sus clientes, espera tener mejores ventas, atraer nuevos clientes y mejorar su economía.
Anhela con ser propietaria de un negocio mucho más rentable para contar con la solvencia económica que le permita continuar ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Maricela is single and doesn’t have children. She lives in her family’s house. In order to help out with the family expenses and cover her own, she started selling clothing and a variety of fruit. Her work schedule is 8:00 am to 4:00 pm. She has experience in managing her business. 

She will buy clothing in a variety of colors, styles, and sizes, for men, women, and children so she will have better options for her clients. She hopes to have better sales, attract new clients, and improve her economic situation.

She dreams of having a more profitable business so she can have an economic situation that will allow her to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Terisa

texts.en:
Terisa is a 36 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling fish, crabs, and octopus in her community and has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan to buy fishing nets, spears and a new canoe. 

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Terisa will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, spears and a new canoe.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en: Antonina is 32 years old and a single woman with no children. She runs a small business selling bananas, taamu etc in her community and to the public. She has been doing this for many years. Antonina has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a rake, a backpack sprayer, a wheelbarrow and boots. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Antonina will improve her family's standard of living and assist with her plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a rake, a backpack sprayer, a wheelbarrow and boots

loans.name: Galulolo

texts.en: Galulolo is 33 years old and a partner woman with six children. She runs a small business selling vegetables in her community and has been doing this for many years. Galulolo has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a garden hose, a rake, gloves, a shovel, fertilizer and a pickaxe. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Galulolo will expand her business to the market.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a garden hose, a rake, gloves, a shovel, fertilizer and a pickaxe

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de carne,la socia ya tiene en este negocio 7 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de carne.La socia solicita le credito para comprar carne.



La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower continues working in the meat-selling business. She has already had this business for 7 years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her meat-selling business. She is applying for the loan to buy meat.

She feels grateful for the loan that has been granted and promises to make her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.en: Abelardo is a hardworking father and husband who operates a farming business. He vigilantly works at this business to lift his family out of poverty. He is now 42 years old and still has poor living conditions. He never stops aiming for progress through his farming business. To make it possible, he is requesting additional capital of PHP 20,000 to purchase fertilizer and insecticides, which are necessary in operating the business. Abelardo is hoping that very soon, he can provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a father who dreams of having a better way of living.He is a farmer who grows rice crops on his rice farmland. Every crop season, Mario’s goal is to produce a high yield. He always visits his farm to assure that his crop is in good condition.

Having good crops is quite hard, due to some factors such as weather conditions and sometimes fertilizers and herbicides insufficiently applied  to the rice field. In this connection,Mario is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy herbicides, pesticides, and fertilizers for his crops. He will also use the loan to pay for the labor cost of farming. Mario hopes to produce a higher yield and increase his income as well.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, pesticides, and fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Johny Lou

texts.en: Johny Lou is a civil engineer student in Misamis University Ozamiz City. He used his previous loan to pay tuition fees and recently borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to pay tuition fees for the second semester this current year.  He is thankful to GDMPC that helps them to finish his course. He is hopeful to find a job and able to help his parents repay his loan.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for the second semester this current year

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer helps in working their farm growing and harvesting coconut for a living. She has been doing this for more than ten years that she was able to provide her four childrens' needs. She had joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a new loan to  purchase organic fertilizer to improve her farm. Hopefully, Jennifer earns good return from the farm to improve the living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to improve her farm

loans.name: Jurinda

texts.en: Jurinda, married with three children, is raising and selling pigs. She has been doing this for more than two years earning well that she was able to support her children in sending to school. Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to build pig's cage and other maintenance to improve her business. She is hopeful to gain more returns from her business from the improvements that she had invested.

loans.use: to build pig's cage and other maintenance

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is running a general store selling grocery goods in their community to earn a living. She has been doing this business for more than three years earning well for the family. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional inventory goods to resell in order to improve her store. Elsa wants to provide her family a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory goods to resell

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
This is Gertrudes. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures. She also has a jeepney for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from his business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gertrudes hopes to be more successful in business and dreams to have a happy family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more planting materials and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Nergie

texts.en:
Nergie works hard to support her family. Nergie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Nergie requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Nergie has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Nergie would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en:
Remelyn is 32 years old and has a live-in partner with one child. With one child currently in school, Remelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Remelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like spices, vegetables, soy sauce, vinegar, seasonings, etc. to sell.

Remelyn has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as spices, vegetables, soy sauce, vinegar, seasonings, etc. 

In the future, Remelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like spices, vegetables, soy sauce, vinegar, seasonings, etc. to sell

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza works hard to support her family. Riza is married and has a food vending (chorizo) business in the Philippines.

Riza requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of chorizo to sell.

Riza has been in this business for 8 years now.

Riza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of chorizo to sell

loans.name: Robie

texts.en:
Robie is 24 years old and married with two children.

Robie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like detergent soap, canned goods, toothpaste, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

Robie has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods.

Robie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like detergent soap, canned goods, toothpaste, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rocina

texts.en:
Rocina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rocina is 56 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Rocina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rocina requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Rocina has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Rocina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. Rebecca is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rebecca requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Rebecca has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Roquena

texts.en:
Roquena works hard to support her family. Roquena is married and has an egg vending business in the Philippines.

Roquena requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional trays of eggs to sell.

Roquena has been in this business for 5 years now.

Roquena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional trays of eggs to sell

loans.name: Rechil

texts.en:
Rechil is 18 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rechil has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Rechil requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, etc. for her business.

Rechil has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rechil would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase shells, wire, nylon threads, etc. for her business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Rosalie is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalie is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rosalie has a direct selling fullerlife and personal collection products business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of fullerlife and personal collection products to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for 3 years. Rosalie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fullerlife and personal collection products to sell

loans.name: Tusifolau

texts.en:
Tusifolau is 27 years old and a married woman with three children. She runs a small business selling bananas, taamu, etc. in her community and has been doing this for many years. Tusifolau has requested a loan to buy chemicals, backpack sprayer, tarpaulin, wheelbarrow and bush knives. 

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tusifolau will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, backpack sprayer, tarpaulin, wheelbarrow and bush knives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bread, sweet potatoes, eggs, and other things.

loans.name: Laufofoga

texts.en: Laufofoga is 31 years old married woman with 6 children. She would like to start a small business, selling ie lavalava in her community. In order to do this, Laufofofga needs a loan to buy fabric material, design board, paint brush and new sewing machine. She hopes to use her profits to save for family needs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy fabric material, design board, paint brush and new sewing machine.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 26 year old married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Fatima has requested a loan to buy fertilizers, weed killers, hose, wheel barrow, spades, shovels. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Fatima hopes to improve her business to help family matters and her kids educations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, weed killers, hose, wheel barrow, spades, shovels.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de zapatillas,la socia ya tiene varios años y le va muy bien en este negocio,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las zapatillas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar zapatillas.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member continues with her business selling slippers.  She has worked in this business for eight years and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to have a store to sell her slippers.

The member's requesting the loan to buy slippers.

She's grateful for the loan she has been granted and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy slippers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesanias,la socia vende chalinas,chompas,guantes y chullos,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesania.La socia solicita el credito para comprar chompas y chalinas.

La socia esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower continues with her business of selling crafts. She sells scarves, sweaters, gloves, and wool caps. She has a number of years of experience in this business. Her dream is to expand her business of selling crafts. She is applying for the loan to buy sweaters and scarves.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and scarves to sell

loans.name: Marisol Modesta

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,la socia vende pantalones,casacas y chompas,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le vamuy bie,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pantalones,chompas y casacas.

Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This borrower continues working in her business of selling clothing. She sells pants, jackets, and sweaters. She already has five years of experience in this business, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell clothing. She is applying for the loan to buy pants, sweaters, and jackets.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy pants, sweaters, and jackets to sell

loans.name: Espiranza

texts.en: Espiranza is 31 years of age and married to Warmer. The couple is thankful because they had been blessed with two school-aged children. To raise them, Espiranza is engaged in selling home products in the market of Centro 1, San Guillermo. She has been in this kind of business for almost seven years and earns about a net income of PHP 300 to PHP 500 a day. Espiranza wants to avail a loan amounting to PHP 18,000 to buy new items of home products such as kitchen supplies, slippers and clothes to sell and expand her product offering. She hopes to grow her business and improve her living situation someday.

loans.use: to buy new items of home products such as kitchen supplies and slippers to sell

loans.name: Avelyn

texts.en: Avelyn is 49, married and has two school-age children. She is engaged in the business of buying and selling accessories, Splash, MSE and AVON products within her community. Being kind and friendly in business, she encourages a lot of customers. For this reason, she plans to acquire more stocks of these products but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy lotions, body sprays, colognes, underwear, umbrellas and accessories to sell. She is hoping that her loan will help her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more accessories, Splash, MSE and Avon Products to sell

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en: Ruben plants and harvests rice to sell in the local community to earn a living and has been in this business for more than six years. He earns well for the family and he was able to repay his previous loan from GDMPC He used his previous loan to buy farming inputs. Recently, he borrowed a new loan to purchase fertilizers and pay weeding maintenance costs. He is hoping to gain more returns from the farm because he invested more and works diligently. Ruben wants to provide a better life for his family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay weeding maintenance costs

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula is 59 year old married woman who hails from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She earns a living by selling various snack foods. Her business started quite a few years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy sugar, baking soda, flour and farm fertilizers.

In the future, Paula would like to expand her food vending business to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, baking soda, flour and farm fertilizers

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie plants and harvests rice crops in her rice field. Her husband is her partner in managing their crops. Margie usually shares ideas to have good crops and produce better yield. Generated income in farming business serves as their starting capital again for the next crop. Sometimes her family gets shortages due to emergency cases. In this connection, Margie wanted to borrow a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy fertilizers, hybrid rice seeds and other farm inputs needed. She believes that through the amount of loan she requested, she will be able to help her husband in generating income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, hybrid rice seeds and other farm inputs needed in her farming business

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is a 64 year old married woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She has four grown children. She earns a livelihood by selling fish to their community. Her business started quite a few years ago. She is asking for a loan to have an additional capital to buy more fish and other materials used in fish vending, to generate more income and provide food for the family. 

In the future, Florita hopes to expand her fish vending business and increase business profitability to improve her livelihood status.

loans.use: to have an additional capital to buy more fish  and other materials  used in fish vending

loans.name: Veronie

texts.en: Veronie is a student getting her BS in Aquatic Resource at Mindanao University of Science and Technology (MUST). She strives hard to continue her studies and be able to help her family in the future. Last semester she used her previous loan to cover the cost of tuition fees. Lately, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to pay her current miscellaneous expenses this second semester. She is hopeful that she will find success in the near future.

loans.use: to pay her current miscellaneous expenses this second semester

loans.name: Baby Silvana

texts.es: La señora Baby de 37 años de edad, tiene dos hijos menores que dependen de ella y vive en una casa en alquiler, donde también elabora sus productos de repostería, actividad que la realiza a diario para mantener a su familia ya que su esposo no esta con ella porque se encuentra constantemente fuera de la ciudad por motivos de trabajo, con el fin de mejorar sus herramientas solicita un crédito para comprar un horno industrial más moderno que le permita satisfacer la demanda del mercado local para obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Baby, 37, has two young children who are dependent on her.  She lives in a rental house where she also makes her pastry.

Baby works every day to support her family.  Her husband is no longer with her because he's constantly away from the city for work.

She wants to improve her tools so she's requesting a loan to buy a more modern industrial oven.  This will help her satisfy the local market demand, increase her income, and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven

loans.name: Donata

texts.en:
This is Donata, 37, resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Andres and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Donata operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php25,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Donata dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
This is Corazon, 58, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is single and happy with her life. She is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Corazon operates a Meat stall. They buy meat from suppliers that deliver the meat to respective market stalls. Her products are pork, beef meat and process meat products. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of pork, chicken and beef meat needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Corazon dreams to be more profitable in business and hopes to have a comfortable life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies of pork, chicken and beef meat needed in her business.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a handicraft business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like shells, wire, cutter, etc. for her handicraft business.

Roselyn has been in this business for 6 years. Roselyn earns more income from general store.

Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like shells, wire, cutter, etc. for her business

loans.name: Visilia

texts.en: Visilia is 58 years old married woman with 7 children. She runs a small business selling meat bun in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Visilia has requested a loan to buy flour, chicken, onion, salts, cooking oil and large cooking pot. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Visilia will provide for family daily needs.

loans.use: to buy flour, chicken, onion, salts, cooking oil and large cooking pot.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia Antonieta se sigue dedicando al negocio de fotocopiadora,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de fotocopiadora.La socia solicita el credito para comprar papeles.

La socia esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Antonieta continues with her photocopying business, working from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m.  She has had the business for seven years and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her business.

Antonieta's requesting the loan to buy paper.  She's happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy paper

loans.name: Familia Hesiquio Group

texts.es:
Familia Hesiquio es un grupo integrado por una pareja; ellos viven en una comunidad mazahua caracterizada por tener una vista muy bonita de arboles. La fiesta más celebrada es la del 25 de Julio día de Santa Ana.
Doña Aurelia y Gilberto están casados desde hace ya 33 años juntos han formado una familia con tres hijos de los cuales uno de ellos aun depende. Doña Aurelia se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 15 años plática que su actividad la inició porque sus padres eran comerciantes y desde sus doce años ayudaba a sus padres a recibir a los clientes. Después, se caso con Don Gilberto y decidió ayudar con los gastos del hogar iniciando con la venta de frutas y verduras. Ahora vende ropa en general en el tianguis de los fines de semana, desde muy temprano tiene que instalar su puesto para tener un buen lugar. Aurelia menciona que le gusta mucho su negocio “Siempre me ha gustado el trato con las personas, por eso siempre les hablo con mucho respeto”. Doña Aurelia no tiene ningún problema con su negocio, platica que no quiere tener un local porque pagar la renta de un lugar así es muy caro, su única dificultad es cuando celebran la fiesta patronal de la comunidad porque es cuando las autoridades del pueblo se ponen estrictos y no le permiten poner su puesto de ropa. La única meta de Doña Aurelia es seguir solventando los gastos de su hijo “Él esta estudiando una carrera en contaduría y quiero que la termine y pueda ejercer su profesión para que no tenga que tener un negocio como el nuestro”. La pareja está muy agradecida con Kiva y con VisionFund por el crédito otorgado porque Doña Aurelia invertirá en su negocio de ropa y Don Gilberto invertirá en su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
“Familia Hesiquio” is a group made up of a couple who live in Mazahua, a community known for having a beautiful view of trees.  The most celebrated festival is on July 25; Santa Ana day.

Aurelia and Gilberto have been married for 33 years and have three children, one of whom still depends on them.  Aurelia has been selling clothing for 15 years and says that she stared doing this because her parents were merchants and she helped them greet customers since she was twelve years old.  She later married Gilberto and decided to help with the family expenses and began selling fruits and vegetables.  Now she sells clothing in the market on the weekends.  She has to get up very early in the morning to set up her stall so she can get a good place.

Aurelia says that she likes her business very much. “I’ve always enjoyed dealing with people, and I always talk to them with respect.”  She doesn’t have any problems with her business and says that she doesn’t want to have a shop because rent is very expensive.  Her only difficulty is when the community festival is celebrated and the local authorities do not allow her to set up her clothing stall.

Aurelia’s only goal is to continue paying for her son’s expenses.  “He is studying for an accounting career and I want him to finish and execute his profession so that he will not have to have a business like ours.”  The couple is grateful to Kiva and VisionFund for the loan.  Aurelia will invest into her clothing business, Gilberto will invest into his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

location.town: Santa Ana Nichi, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Ricarte

texts.en:
Ricarte is a helpful person who is engage in beauty salon business. He is renting a stall in front of their municipal public market. Ricarte also offers catering services for all occasions. His goal is to earn higher income in able to extend his support to his parent, brothers and sisters as well.

Ricarte is doing hair coloring, hair styling, pedicure and manicure services. With his aim to have earn greater income, he decided to request a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy materials needed in performing his beauty salon business. He hopes to have continuous smooth flow of his business to have a viable source of income someday.

loans.use: to buy materials needed in performing his beauty salon business

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is a 49 year old woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She is married with 5 children. The youngest child is 4 year old. She engages in hog raising business. Aside from hog raising, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store.She sells various items like eggs, sugar, noodles,canned goods and dry goods.  She is asking for a loan to buy more items like  seasonings, noodles, soft drinks and canned goods. 

In the future, Ma.Elena would like to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more items like seasonings, noodles, soft drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Oscar Arturo

texts.es: El  señor Oscar tiene 45 años de edad, es de estado civil soltero, no cuenta con personas bajo su dependencia y logro cursar hasta el nivel técnico en la carrera de agronomía, pero no pudo ejercer dicha profesión debido a la falta de recursos y las exigencias que tienen algunas empresas. Actualmente trabaja en una empresa de servicio de mototaxis, en la cual le cancelan un sueldo mínimo, pero que ayuda a su diario vivir.  Vive en casa de su madre, en un pequeño cuarto que le presta, pero el mismo tiene algunos daños y existen muchas goteras, por ello solicita un crédito para refacción y mantenimiento de su vivienda, con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida
texts.en: Señor Oscar is 45 years old. He is single and has no dependents. He was able to go to school through the technical level of the curriculum in agronomy, but he was not able to work in this profession due to the lack of resources and the requirements that some businesses have. Now he works in a mototaxi service business, where they pay him a minimal salary, but it helps in his daily living. He lives in the house of his mother, in a little room that she provides him, but it has some damage and there are many leaks. For this reason, he is applying for a loan to improve and maintain his home, with the goal of improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to make improvements and do maintenance on his house.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Sabina works hard to support her family.

She has a handicraft business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Sabina is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase more materials for her handicraft business.

Sabina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her handicraft business

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor Mario está casado y tiene un hijo, trabaja desde hace más de 12 años en un taller de radiadores para sacar adelante a su familia, con los ingresos provenientes de su trabajo compro su casa y otros materiales, actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de herramientas y materiales para radiadores,  lo que le ayudara  a mejorar sus servicios y también lograra cubrir todos los gastos de su familia y brindarles un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Señor Mario is married and has a son. He has worked for more than 12 years in a radiator workshop in order to raise his family. With the income from this work, he bought his house and other materials. Now he is applying for a loan to purchase tools and materials for radiators, which will help him to improve his services, and he will also manage to cover all the family expenses and offer them a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials for radiators

loans.name: Las Margaritas Catarina Group

texts.es:
La señora Elvira Modesta es casada. De edad 56 años. De escolaridad primaria completa. Tiene 5 hijos y ni 1 esta estidiando. Se dedica al comercio, específicameente vende ropa para niños. Inició este negocio con un pequeño capital que tenia ahorrado y a la fecha lleva 13 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para ampliar su capital de trabajo comprando más mercadería para surtir el negocio. En el futuro desea tener un capital grande y poder generar mejores ganancias.

Las demás interantes del grupo se dedican al comercio de ropa. 

En la fotografía aparecen 6 integrantes, pero, solo a 5 de ellas se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Elvira Modesta, 56, is married.  She completed elementary school.  She has five children and not one of them attends school.

Elvira Modesta makes a living in commerce; specifically, she sells children's clothing.  She started this business with a small amount of capital she had saved.  Currently she has 13 years of experience.

Elvira Modesta's organizing a group and requesting a loan to expand her working capital by buying more merchandise to stock her business.  In the future she wants to have a lot of capital and be able to earn more profits.

The other members of the group sell clothing.

There are six members in the photograph but only five of them were granted the loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food

loans.name: Deborah De Samarie Group

texts.fr:
Jackson est le coordinateur de son groupe Deborah de Samarie. Il est marieet Il a 2 enfants. Il habite dans la région nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limitée.

Jackson dirige son commerce d'articles divers pendants les 12 dernières années. Avant de ce commercer ce commerce Il était un PROFESEUR. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce.

Des autres membres Deborah de Samarie ont besoin d’un emprunt pour le commerce tel que ventes produits alimenteurs, boissons gazeuses, charbon, etc. Il déclare que 
son défi principal est de devenir un grand commerçant dans le département du nord. 

Il dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera à construire une 
grande maison avec l’aide d’Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Jackson is the coordinator of the group "Deborah de Samarie." He is married and has two children. He lives in the north of Haiti, where electricity is rare and access to drinking water very limited.

For the past 12 years, Jackson has been managing his business selling miscellaneous items. Before launching this business, he used to be a teacher. He hopes that this loan will allow him to grow his business. The other members of his group need a loan for their respective businesses, such as selling food items, soft drinks, charcoal etc. Jackson says that his main challenge is to become a major vendor in the North Department of Haiti. His main goal is to expand his business, which will allow him to build a big house with the help of Esperanza Int.
.

loans.use: to buy  miscellaneous items [for resale].

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mujeres Humildes Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Humildes está en su ciclo número 17 del programa de comité de mujeres, son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, donde todas y cada una está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo por salir adelante y es por eso que están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sandra, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, pero es consciente  que solo a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y también a través de la venta de bijouteries que está ayudando a su familia. Ella esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder mejorar.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para hacer bijouterie, como ser canutillos, hilos, y demás accesorios para seguir haciendo bijouterie.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Humildes” group is in its 17th cycle in the committee for women program.  These are very hardworking and enterprising women and each one is putting forth her best effort to get ahead and this is why they are in the elimination of poverty program.

Sandra is one of the members who demonstrated a level two poverty level in the last survey, but she knows that she is helping her family through her effort and sale of costume jewelry.  She is grateful for this opportunity to improve.

She is asking for this loan to buy supplies, such as beads, thread, and other accessories to make costume jewelry.

loans.use: to buy supplies..

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es: Araceli vive en una comunidad muy pequeña, sus vecinos son muy amables, algunas personas de la misma comunidad aún conservan su lengua materna que es el mazahua. Doña Araceli es una persona muy trabajadora siempre está muy apurada atendiendo sus negocios. Ella tiene 42 años de edad y estudio la secundaria, está casada con el señor José Saúl, tienen dos dependientes que aun asisten a la escuela. Doña Araceli está solicitando un crédito a VisionFund y KIVA para invertir en su negocio de la venta de pollos. Ella tiene un pequeño puestecito en su casa donde atiende sus clientes, ahí mismo tiene un pequeña granja donde están sus pollos vivos. Platica también que el mejor periodo de ventas buenas es cuando en la comunidad hay algún evento importante porque es cuando los vecinos compran más pollos. "Siempre me ha gustado ayudar con los gastos del hogar y la educación de mis hijos", es por ello que no planea dejar a un lado su actividad. Anteriormente Doña Araceli se dedicaba a la cría y engorda de borregos pero eran animales que crecían muy lento y sus ganancias no eran muy buenas ahora con los pollos, su dinero tiene mayor movimiento. Doña Araceli no tiene ninguna dificultad con su negocio solo cuando le hace falta dinero para comprar mas animalitos pero gracias al crédito podrá comprar suficientes para no tener preocupaciones en los siguientes meses. La única meta de Doña Araceli es poder hacer crecer su negocio para tener mayores ganancias y tener asegurada de alguna manera la educación de sus hijos. Para Doña Araceli la formación profesional de sus hijos es indispensable.
texts.en:
Araceli lives in a small community and her neighbors are very friendly.  Some people in the community maintain their native language, called “Mazahua.”  Araceli is a hardworking person who always busy tending to her businesses.

She is 42 years old and has a middle school education.  She is married to Jose Saul and has two children who attend school.  Araceli is asking for a loan through VisionFund and Kiva so she can invest into her chicken selling business.  She has a small shop in her house where she serves her customers and also has a chicken farm where she keeps her chickens.  She says that the best season for her sales is when there is an important event in the community because it’s when the residents buy more chickens.  “I’ve always enjoyed helping with the household expenses and my children’s educations,” and this is why she has no plans to stop doing this.

Araceli previously raised sheep, but they were animals that grew very slowly and her profits were not very good.  Now the money is better with chickens.  Araceli has no trouble with her business, except when she needs money to buy more animals, but she is able to buy enough thanks to the loan and not have any worries over the coming months.  Araceli’s only goal is to be able to grow her business to have greater profits and ensure her children’s education.  For Araceli, her children becoming professionals is indispensable.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

location.town: La Cienega, San Felipe del progreso

loans.name: Edwin Edgar

texts.es: El  señor  Edwin  tiene 32 años, es soltero y vive en su propia casa, desde muy joven trabajo junto a sus padres ayudando en sus negocios,ahora es independiente y se dedica al servicio del transporte  con una antigüedad de ocho años. Actualmente trabaja en una empresa de radio taxis en calidad de propietario de su vehículo, pero el mismo necesita un cambio, por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de una caja mecánica para su vehiculo, de esa manera podrá seguir trabajando y lograra obtener más ingresos.
texts.en: Edwin is 32 years old. He is single and lives in his own house. Since he was young, he has worked alongside his parents helping with their business. Now he is an adult and has made a living in the transportation service for the last eight years. Currently, he works in a radio taxi business of good quality. Edwin owns his own vehicle, but he needs to change it. That is why he is requesting this loan. He is requesting a loan to buy a cashier's box for his vehicle. This will help him to continue working and improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy a cashier's box for his vehicle.

loans.name: Oasis Group

texts.es: Cristina, quien está a un costado derecho de la fotografía junto a su marido con su bebé y de polera café, pertenece al Banco Comunal Oasis, que está ubicado en Arauco Región del Biobío. Los socios de este Banco Comunal tienen diversos rubros tales como venta de café y té en las ferias, servicio de encomiendas, bazar y paquetería, venta de ropa nueva y deportiva,  venta de cortinas, perfumería, almacén y frutería, botillería, bazar y librería, tejidos y bordados. Cristina estudió 4 años costura y confección es por esto que comenzó hace 5 años con el negocio de la venta de disfraces, aunque antes estuvo trabajando en un taller, en el cual se dio cuenta que su fuerte en el trabajo era la confección de disfraces. Su problema es no tener quién pueda cuidar de su pequeña hija, ya que hasta el momento debe trabajar junto a ella. El dinero que está solicitando es para comprar insumos como telas agujas e hilos y seguir confeccionando cortinas y disfraces. Lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de poder encontrarse con gente y con sus diversas realidades, con asesores que pueden ayudarlos y apoyarlos y compartir distintas vivencias que son de una gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Cristina (in the photograph she's wearing a brown shirt and standing at the side with her husband and baby) belongs to Oasis Communal Bank, located in the Biobío region of Arauco.  The members of this bank are in different lines of work: selling coffee and tea in markets; message and packing services; selling new clothing and athletic clothing; selling curtains and perfume; department store, fruit sales, liquor store, and stationery store; weaving and embroidery.

Cristina studied sewing and tailoring for four years.  Five years ago she started her business making costumes.  Previously she worked in a tailor shop, where she realized that her strength was making costumes.  Her problem is she doesn't have anyone to take care of her young daughter, who currently goes to work with her.

The money Cristina's requesting is to buy supplies such as fabric, needles, and thread so she can keep on making curtains and costumes.

What Cristina has enjoyed most about working with Fondo Esperanza is meeting people from different backgrounds, meeting with counselors who can help and support them, and sharing life experiences, which is a big help.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, and thread

loans.name: Celia Emelina

texts.es:
Celia, necesita capital para comprar arroz, frijol, aceite, maíz, carnes y verduras, con lo que continuara elaborando la comida y tamales que luego ofrece en su negocio.
La inversión anterior le ayudo a tener la materia prima para su negocio, le permitió tener más clientes, aumentar sus ventas y tener ingresos que necesita para continuar dando un estilo diferente a su familia. Sus hijos siguen estudiando y ella les da su apoyo.
texts.en:
Celia needs capital to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, corn, meats, and vegetables so she can continue making food and tamales that she sells in her business.

The previous investment helped her have ingredients for her business, that allowed her to have more customers, increase her sales, and have the income she needs to continue providing a different style to her family.  Her children continue to attend school and she can better support them.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Yesenia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Yesenia, necesita capital para pagar mano de obra, que le ayude a recolectar la cosecha así como también trasladar a su casa, para poder percibir sus ganancias mucho más rápido.
Con el crédito anterior compro los insumos agrícolas necesarios, lo que le ayudo a mejorar su cosecha, tener una producción más grande, mejorar sus ventas y aumentar las ganancias. Por el momento su familia está muy saludable.
texts.en:
Yesenia needs money to pay for labor to help her with her harvest and transport it to her home so she can make a profit in less time.

She used her previous loan to buy needed farming supplies and this helped her improve her harvest, increase her production, and improve her sales and income.  Her family is very healthy at the moment.

loans.use: to pay for labor.

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Мехринисо 47-летняя замужняя женщина. Она проживает в селе Яванского района с мужем и детьми. Она домохозяйка и нигде не работает. В данный момент она готовится к открытию нового бизнеса. Мехринисо собирается выращивать крупнорогатый скот для дальнейшей продажи. По причине того, что она не имеет достаточного начального капитала, она обратилась за кредитом. Мехринисо просит в кредит 1500 долларов, чтобы купить трех голов крупнорогатого скота. У Мехринисо при дворе дома имеется старый сарай, который она будет использовать в качестве коровника. Кормом для скота она тоже уже запаслась. Ей осталось только закупить скот.
texts.en: Mehriniso is a 47 year-old married woman.  She lives in a village in the Yavan district with her husband and children.  She is a homemaker and is not employed anywhere.  At the present time, she is getting ready to open a new business.  Mehriniso plans to raise cattle for subsequent sale.  Because she does not have a sufficient initial capital, she requested this loan.  Mehriniso is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 dollars to buy three heads of cattle.  Mehriniso has an old barn in a yard of her house, which she will use as a cowshed.  She has already stocked up on livestock feed.  She only has to buy livestock.

loans.use: to buy three cows and start her own business

loans.name: Los Limones El Rodeo Group

texts.es:
La señora Ludy Aracely de estado civil casada. De edad 55 años. Curdó 5 años de educación primaria. Tiene 6 hijos y 3 de ellos estan estudiando. Se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde. Inició este negocio con el fin de apoyar a su esposo en la economía del hogar y a la fecha lleva  20 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de 5 docenas de pollos para engordarlos y luego venderlos, tambien compará concentrado para los mismos. Desea en el futuro contar con una granja de pollos de engorde y tambien ponedoras.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales de corral y al comercio.
texts.en:
Ludy Aracely is a married woman. She is 55 years old. She finished five years of elementary school education. Ludy Aracley has six children, three of whom are in school. She makes a living raising and fattening chickens. Ludy Aracely began working in this business 20 years ago in order to support her husband with the household finances. 

She organizes a group that is requesting a loan, which Ludy Aracey will use to buy five dozen chickens to fatten and later sell. She will also by concentrate for the chickens. She hopes in the future to own a chicken farm for fattening chickens and laying hens. 

The other members of the group make a living raising animals and in sales.

loans.use: to buy chickens and concentrate.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es: El señor Wilder tiene 22 años de edad, vive en la casa de sus padres y ayuda con los gastos de su casa, desde hace tres años se dedica a prestar servicios como ayudante de carpintería en un taller, donde muestra responsabilidad y muchas ganas de superarse, actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de muebles y enseres que le hacen falta, de esta manera podrá satisfacer sus necesidades y las de su familia para brindarles mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Wilder is 22 years old. He lives in his parents' house and helps with the household expenses. For three years, he has worked as an assistant carpenter in a shop, where he has shown responsibility and the desire to excel. Currently, he is requesting a loan in order to buy furniture and some basic tools that he needs. This will help him to meet his needs and those of his family so he can offer them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy furniture and basic tools.

loans.name: Edith Elizabeth

texts.es:
Edith, es madre de dos hijos de 8 y 12 años de edad, ella es casada, se dedica a vender ropa y tambien vende en ocaiones panes con pollo, lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, lo realiza de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., no posee ayuda del extranjero, por el momento no ha tenido problemas en tener este tipo de negocio.
Comprará pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisas, y trajes para niños, con  lo que piensa mejorar la variedad de productos para satisfacer a sus clientes, espera tener un negocio más rentable que le de los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus gastos y cancelar las cuotas del crédito.
Sueña con equipar su casa con electrodomésticos necesarios para mejorar el estilo familiar así como también hacer mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Edith is the mother of two children, 8 and 12, and is married. She makes her living selling clothes and also sells bread with chicken on occasion. She learned by her own initiative, she carries out the work from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM. She does not have external help; for the moment she has not had problems in having this type of business. She will buy pants, skirts, blouses, shirts and clothing for boys, with which she is thinking of improving the variety of products to satisfy her customers.

She hopes to have a more profitable business that gives her the necessary income to cover her expenses and pay off the loan payments. She dreams of equipping her house with the necessary appliances to improve the family style and make improvements to her home as well.

loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, blouses, shirts and clothing for boys.

loans.name: Norbert

texts.ru:
Норберт не женат.  Он работает на ВЕТ «Автомотив» на должности мастера. Норберт учится на четвертом году обучения в колледже и ему тяжело насобирать всю сумму - 7,000 гривен - чтобы оплатить за весь год, как того требует колледж. Норберт надеется, что полученное образование поможет ему получить новую работу с большим доходом.

Норберт просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 5,000 гривен на обучение (а 2,000 гривен он собрал сам).
texts.en: Norbert is not married.  He works at a plant BET "Avtomotiv" as a technician.  Norbert is a fourth-year-student at a college and is having a hard time to get the entire sum  - 7,000 hryvnia - to pay tuition for the year as the college requires.  Norbert hopes that the obtained education will help him get a new job with a high income.  Norbert is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 hryvnia for education (and he saved 2,000 hryvnia on his own).

loans.use: to pay for education costs

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.ru: Улугбеку 29 лет. Он деятельный и трудолюбивый человек, проживающий в районе Яван. Улугбек зарабатывает на жизнь, работая таксистом. Он женат, имеет детей. Братья Улугбека занимаются бизнесом куплей-продажей крупнорогатого скота. Он видит какой это прибыльный бизнес и решил тоже начать данный бизнес. Улугбек накопил почти 700 долларов США. Недостающую сумму 800 долларов он просит в кредит. Улугбек на эти деньги собирается приобрести 4 голов бычков. Естественно в начале бизнеса ему будут помогать братья советами, то есть какую породу бычков лучше покупать, как выращивать и продавать. Поэтому он верит в успешность своего бизнеса и надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Ulugbek is 29 years old.  He is an active and hardworking person living in the Yavan district.  Ulugbek earns a living working as a taxi driver.  He is married and has children.  Ulugbek's brothers are involved in reselling cattle.  He sees this as a profitable business and decided to also start this business.  Ulugbek saved almost 700 dollars.  He is requesting the remaining sum of 800 dollars as a loan.  Ulugbek plans to use this money to buy 4 heads of bulls.  Obviously, his brothers will be helping him with the business by advising him what breed of bulls to buy and how to raise and sell them.  This is why he believes in the success of his business and hopes for support.

loans.use: to buy four bulls and start his own animal husbandry business

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru: Умедчон позитивный молодой человек в возрасте 28 лет. Он родился и вырос в кишлаке. Умедчон женат и имеет троих детей. Сам он работает учителем в местной школе. Но так как он имеет большую семью, одной заработной платы, которую он получает в школе, недостаточно. Поэтому Умедчон начал свой маленький бизнес и надеется его расширить, чтобы получать достаточный доход. Он дополнительно занимается животноводством. Он также сотрудничает с Арванд уже давно, первый свой кредит он взял на покупку первого скота. Умедчон является добросовестным клиентом, который своевременно выплачивает свои обязательства по кредиту. Умедчон рассказывает, что после того, как он начал сотрудничество с Арванд, его жизнь изменилась в лучшую сторону и он благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.  Сейчас Умедчон хочет взять кредит на покупку скота, чтобы расширить свой бизнес и получать больше прибыли. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Umedjon is a positive young man, who is 28 years old.  He was born and raised in a village.  Umedjon is married and has three children.  He works as a teacher at a local school, but because he has a large family, the salary that he earns at the school is not enough.  This is why Umedjon started his own business and hopes to expand it in order to earn enough income.  He is additionally involved in animal husbandry.  He has also been partnering with Arvand for a long time.  He obtained his first loan to buy first livestock.  Umedjon is a conscientious client, who repays his loan responsibilities timely.  Umedjon says that after he started partnering with Arvand, his life changed for the better, and he thanks Arvand for the financial support.  Now Umedjon wants to obtain a loan to buy livestock in order to expand his business and earn more profit.  He hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Zafarjon

texts.ru: Зафарчон трудолюбивый и ответственный мужчина в возрасте 35 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Зафарчон со своей женой живут дружно и стараются воспитывать своих детей хорошими людьми, он и его жена очень рады растить своих детей. Для того, чтобы иметь доход на проживание Зафарчон занимается своим бизнесом. Зафарчон  уже давно работает таксистом. У него имеется для этого собственный автомобиль. Но эта машина служит ему уже долгое время и много раз приходилось её чинить. Поэтому сейчас он планирует купить новую, более улучшенную машину для ведения и расширения своего бизнеса. Этот бизнес приносит Зафарчону хороший доход, но его хватает только на проживание. А для того, чтобы купить новую машину требуются денежные средства. Поэтому Зафарчон обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку машины для ведения своего бизнеса. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Zafarjon is a hardworking and responsible 35 year-old man.  He is married and has three children.  Zafarjon and his wife live happily and try to raise their children to become good people.  He and his wife are very glad to be raising their children.  Zafarjon is involved in his own business in order to have an income for living.  Zafarjon has been working as a taxi driver for a long time.  He owns a car for this occupation, but this car has been serving him for a long time and had to be repaired many times.  This is why he is currently planning to purchase a new, improved car in order to run and expand his business.  This business yields a good income for Zafarjon, but it is only enough for living expenses.  And he needs money to buy a new car.  This is why Zafarjon came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy a car in order to run his business.  He hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy a new car

loans.name: Azizkhon

texts.ru: Азизхон деятельный, целеустремленный человек в возрасте 59 лет. Он живет в районе Яван с женой, четырьмя сыновьями, невестками и внуками. Азизхон сейчас начинает торговый бизнес. Он рядом со своим домом построил помещение для магазина и собирается заняться там продажей продуктов питания. Для этой цели Азизхону не хватает 1000 долларов и эту сумму он просит в кредит. На сумму кредита он собирается приобрести ассортимент продуктов питания. Азизхон открыв данный бизнес, хочет обеспечить жителей своего села свежими и качественными продуктами питания, а себя прибыльной работой.
texts.en: Azizkhon is an active and driven 59 year-old person.  He lives in the Yavan district with his wife, four sons, daughters-in-law and grandsons.  Azizkhon is currently starting his own retail business.  He built a space for a store near his house and plans to start selling food products there.  Azizkhon is short 1000 dollars to achieve his goal and is requesting this sum as a loan.  He plans to purchase a selection of food products with this loan.  Having opened this business, Azizkhon wants to provide residents of his village with fresh and quality food products and himself with profitable work.

loans.use: to buy food products and open his own store

loans.name: Mahmadrajabi

texts.ru: Махмадрачаби начинающий предприниматель, живет в районе Яван. Ему 53 года. Он в течение нескольких лет ездил со своими сыновьями в Россию на заработки. Теперь он решил больше не покидать свою страну и здесь открыть собственный бизнес. Махмадрачаби планирует заняться продажей мужской одежды. Он уже в хорошем месте взял в аренду помещение и будет использовать его в качестве магазина продажи мужской одежды. Однако чтобы начать свой бизнес Махмадрачаби нуждается в кредите. Он просит в кредит 3000 долларов США. Махмадрачаби собирается на сумму кредита закупить коллекцию сезонной мужской одежды. Он будет привозить товар с оптового рынка города Душанбе и продавать в своем магазине в районе Яван по розничной цене. Он надеется на Вашу поддержку. Если он откроет бизнес, он обеспечит себя и своих сыновей работой, и им больше не придется покидать страну и скитаться по чужим краям в поисках работы. В канун Нового Года Махмадрачаби верит в чудо и в осуществлении своих намеченных целей.
texts.en: Mahmadrajabi is a beginner entrepreneur, living in the Yavan district.  He is 53 years old.  He spent several years going to Russia with his sons for work.  Now he decided not to leave his country anymore and open his own business here.  Mahmadrajabi plans to get involved in selling men's clothing, however, Mahmadrajabi needs a loan to start his business.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 US dollars.  Mahmadrajabi plans to use this loan to buy a collection of seasonal men's clothing.  He will bring merchandise from a wholesale market in the city of Dushanbe and sell it at his own store in the Yavan district at a retail price.  He is hoping for Your support.  If he opens his business, he will provide himself and his sons with work, and they will no longer have to leave their country and travel foreign lands searching for work.  At the onset of the New Year, Mahmadrajabi believes in a miracle and making his set goals come true.

loans.use: to buy seasonal men's clothing and start his own business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
This is Juliet. She previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that she used to buy products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings for her food stall. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in meeting the family's personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits will definitely help her  sustain her daily needs and pay educational expenses for her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Juliet hopes that her business will thrive and dreams to have a happy and abundant life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients, like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru: Олимчон  трудолюбивый и добродушный мужчина в возрасте 42 лет.  Он женат и имеет троих детей. Он родился и по сей день живёт в горном кишлаке. С самого детства он обучался у своего отца животноводству. Он набрал столько опыта, что сейчас он самостоятельно  ведёт данный бизнес и тем самым получает хороший и стабильный доход. Олимчон также является клиентом Арванд, и  является ответственным клиентом. На сегодня он уже вырастил и продал скот, которых имел. Полученную прибыль он потратил на обеспечение своих детей. И сейчас Олимчон желает закупить ещё несколько голов скота для выращивания и дальнейшей продажи. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Olimjon is a hardworking and kind 42 year-old person.  He is married and has three children.  He was born still lives in a mountaineous village.  Since childhood, he had learned animal husbandry from his father.  He gained so much experience that now he is running this business by himself and earns a good and stable income with it.  Olimjon is also a client of Arvand and is a responsible client.  Today, he has already raised and sold livestock that he had.  He spent the resulting profit on providing for his children.  And now Olimjon wishes to buy several more heads of livestock for fattening up and subsequent resale.  This is why he came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy livestock.  He hopes very much for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Faasaveve

texts.en: Faasaveve is 42 years old and married with six children. She plans to start a business selling canned fish, flour, sugar, salt, ice cream, chicken legs, etc. She has requested a loan to buy a freezer, snacks, soft drinks, flour, sugar, salt and soap. Faasaveve will use her profits to help her family and support her children's education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, flour, sugar, salts, freezer and soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods for her store.

loans.name: Rito

texts.en: Rito is married with three children and runs a motorcycle service business to earn a living. He has been doing this for two years, earning income for the family's basic needs. To improve services, he needs to repair his existing vehicle. Rito joined GDMPC and requested a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover the cost of motorcycle maintenance. Rito wants to improve the general living situation of his family in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the cost of motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
This is Rochelle. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy duck eggs, baskets, and crackers for her Balut business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in meeting the family's personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy duck eggs, baskets, and crackers. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in more profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rochelle hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She attends weekly fellowship meetings* that inspire her to go on with life no matter what the obstacles because she has a big God who will never fail her. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for duck eggs, baskets, and crackers.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 32 years old and married with two children currently in school. Sheila works very hard to provide for her family.

Sheila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like shampoo, sanitary napkins, diapers, eggs and laundry soap to sell.

Sheila has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items in her store. 

Sheila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like shampoo, sanitary napkins, diapers, eggs and laundry soap to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 46 years old and is married with four children. The oldest child is 19 years old and is in high school, while the youngest is 8 and is in primary school. 

She has been running this business for over 2 years, which makes her very experienced and her business profitable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will help her increase her revenue by 30 percent and her standard of living will be improved as well.

loans.use: to buy fruit in large quantities, to re-sell in smaller quantities.

loans.name: Mujeres Vallientes Group

texts.es:
19 mujeres muy trabajadoras forman parte de este grupo muy trabajador y unido, ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza que les permitirá conocer en qué situación se encuentra cada una y conforme a eso poder trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Luisa, quien en su primera  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir con niveles medios, pero ella es consciente que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza, y pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos de limpieza para la venta.
texts.en:
This hard-working, united group is formed by 19 dedicated women who participate in the poverty elimination program to know their individual situation and work accordingly.

One of the members of the group is Luisa who shows a level two poverty situation on the survey, meaning she is at an intermediate level.  But she is conscious that through effort and continuous work, as well as by applying the characteristics of a successful woman, she will improve her poverty situation.  She sells cleaning products and is requesting a loan to buy products to sell.

loans.use: To buy cleaning products to sell.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
El señor Andres tiene 28 años, es soltero, vive con sus papas y hermanos, comenta que trabajó desde muy joven en la venta de leche.
Su familia tiene una granja y tiene varias vacas lecheras, al comienzo contaba con una moto en la cual hacia sus repartos de leche, empezando con unos pocos clientes, gracias al trabajo arduo y al buen trato con las personas, ha ido aumentando su clientela, en la actualidad ya cuenta con un moto carro en el cual reparte su leche, siendo sus clientes gran parte de la ciudad. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar 2 vacas lecheras que le ayudará a poder seguir mejorando su producción de leche.
texts.en:
Andres, 28, is single and lives with his parents and siblings.  He says he has worked selling milk since he was young.  His family has a farm and several dairy cows.  At first, he used a motorcycle to delivery the milk to a few customers but, thanks to his hard work and good service, he has increased his customer base.  Now he has a mini-truck to deliver the milk to customers around much of the city.

He is requesting a loan to buy two dairy cows to help improve milk production.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
El Sr. Alcides tiene 28 años y está casado con la Maria que también tiene 28 años, tienen 2 hijos, uno de 2 años y otro de 7 años que ya está en la escuela.
Él tiene una despensa que es atendida por su esposa y por él, además tiene un camión con el que se dedica a la venta y reparto de huevos en plancha, fideos de distintos tipos y golosinas.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos como ser bebidas, arroz,  azúcar, fideos, yerba, huevos y golosinas en forma mayorista, de esa manera compraría a menor costo y tendría un mayor margen de ganancia. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de crecer.
texts.en:
Alcides, 28, is married to Maria, 28, and they have two children, one who is two years old and another who is seven and attends school.  Alcides owns a store which he and his wife run.  He also has a truck and sells and delivers eggs, noodles and different types of sweets.

He is requesting a loan to buy goods such as drinks, rice, sugar, noodles, herbs, eggs and sweets on a wholesale basis.  This will allow him to buy at a lower cost to increase his profit margin.  He is grateful for this opportunity to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy goods for his store.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 18 years now.

Victoria requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials like shells, nylon threads, etc. for her handicraft business.

Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials like shells, nylon threads, etc. for her handicraft business.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 44 years old, and is married with four children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Zosima has a business buying and selling clothes in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of ready to wear clothes, such as shorts, t-shirts, blouses, etc. to sell to her customers.

Zosima has been in this business for three years. In the future, Zosima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of ready to wear clothes, such as shorts, t-shirts, blouses, etc. to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Roselia

texts.en:
Roselia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 18 years, and earns additional income from selling coconuts.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more materials for her handicraft business.

Roselia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her handicraft business.

loans.name: Zyril

texts.en:
Zyril works hard to support her family. She is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines, which she has been in for five years now. 

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her handicraft business.

Zyril would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her handicraft business.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
This is Sergia, aged 58, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Fredy, and a mother to their children. Sergia, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Sergia operates a house rental business. It is rented on a monthly basis. She also sells frozen and processed foods for additional income. She earns a minimum of 25,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every month. She also has a canteen for additional income.
