Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle va renforcer son épargne et assurer les frais d'études de ses enfants
texts.en:
This group of four women belongs to a Banc Villageois that was created March 29, 2008. They live in the same neighborhood, get along well, and their solidarity is their strength. They conduct commercial activities. 

Aïda, age 45, is the group member standing on the right and raising her hand. She is the married mother of two boys and two girls. She sells fabrics and shoes, and she has extensive experience in this sector. She travels to large cities to purchase fabrics, shoes and milk. 

With this loan, she plans to buy 10 cases of 48 cartons of milk for 100,000F CFA, 100,000 F worth of fabrics, and 75,000 F worth of shoes. The remainder of her loan will be used as working capital. She will use her profits to bolster her savings and to cover her children’s tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, shoes and milk.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Unidas  está en su ciclo número 4º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de las integrantes tienen ingresos muy bajos, por lo que se están esforzando al máximo por poder superarse.
Mirta, una de las miembros, comenta que es vendedora de chipas y pan, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones. Ella es una persona que está luchando por crecer, y de esa forma poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener un local donde hacer sus ventas y de esa forma no tener que hacerlo de forma ambulante.
La Sra. Mirta solicita de este crédito para la compra de sus ingredientes para la realización de sus chipas y pan lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Unidas ("United Women") is in its fourth loan cycle in the women´s committee program, where they work and help each other to get ahead. They are doing a poverty elimination survey, where two of the members were shown to have a very low income, which is why they are working to the maximum to be able to overcome this. 

Mirta, one of the members, says that she sells cheesy buns and bread for a living. She also highlights the work of the poverty program consultants, who continuously monitor and verify the trainings. She is a person who is fighting to grow, and be able to give her family everything that she could not have. One of her dreams is to be able to have a store from which she can make her sales. That way, she would not have to make her sales on foot.

Mirta is requesting this loan for the purchase of the ingredients to make cheesy buns and bread, which will help her to carry out her business plan and thus improve her income.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the preparation of bread and cheesy buns

loans.name: Cerenisa

texts.en:
Cerenisa provides transportation services to earn a living and has been doing this for four years, earning well for the family's needs. 

She was able to repay her previous loan successfully. She used her previous loan to purchase tires and repairs to improve the services provided.

Recently, she borrowed a new loan to cover maintenance costs. In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover maintenance costs.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion helps her husband in their fishing business for a living.  She has been doing this for more than ten years earning well for the family and she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. She used her previous loan to purchase fishing nets to improve her business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to repair her boat used for fishing. Positively, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to repair her boat

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
Luis,  desea aprovechar la temporada de inicio de año escolar para ofrecer mercadería con nuevos estilos y colores a sus clientes, comprara variedad de mochilas, ropa y zapatos, será de gran ayuda para mejorar sus ventas y tener mayores ingresos.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a adquirirla mercadería necesaria para cumplir con las necesidades de sus clientes, su economía ha mejorado y su familia tiene mejores condiciones de vida en su hogar.
texts.en: Luis wants to take advantage of the beginning of the school year to offer merchandise in new styles and colors to his clients. He will buy a variety of backpacks, clothing and shoes which will be a great help in improving his sales and to have more income. The last loan helped him to acquire the merchandise he needed to satisfy the needs of his customers. His finances improved and his family has better living conditions in their home.

loans.use: to buy a variety of backpacks, clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.en:
Peregrina owns and operates a business, tailoring and selling clothing products to local businesses and community members. She also makes curtains and pillowcases to earn more income. 

She earns well from this business and she was able to successfully repay her previous loan. She used her previous loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to purchase materials for her business. 

Recently, Peregrina borrowed a new loan to purchase more fabrics to make curtains and pillows. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics.

loans.name: Edralyn

texts.en:
Edralyn is 30 years old, married, and has two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Edralyn has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from buying and selling coconut candy.

Edralyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. Melanie is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Melanie requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, laundry soap, shampoo, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Melanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, laundry soap, shampoo, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Bebnie

texts.en:
Bebnie is 40 years old and has three children. Bebnie is married and all three of her children are in school.

Bebnie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Bebnie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Bebnie has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Bebnie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rowena is 39 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Rowena has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF for food vending.

Rowena has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, seasonings, etc. for her food vending business.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is 32 years old and a housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. Her husband has owned a hotel for five years, which is the only source of income for their family. 

Sobia, has requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase materials for her husband's hotel, like flour, rice, pulses, and vegetables.

She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them and will bring a positive change to their monthly income.

loans.use: to pay for items, like flour, rice, pulses, and vegetables.

loans.name: Ranko

texts.en:
Ranko lives in a minority community in Kosovo and is a 55-year-old married father of two grown children, one boy and one girl. He works as veterinarian and serves all of the nationalities and people that are living in Kosovo, while his wife is a housewife taking care of their home. 

Ranko’s son recently got married and they are living in the same house. Therefore, Ranko is requesting a loan in order to purchase the necessary building materials for renovating the second floor such as shingles, gravel, and cement. This will allow his son to be able to live separately with his wife and future family. He believes that this loan will help to improve the overall living conditions and environment for his family as Ranko dreams to have a finished home to enjoy with his family in a healthy and comfortable environment. He wants to thank all of the lenders!

loans.use: To purchase the necessary building materials for renovating the second floor.

loans.name: Ibush

texts.en:
Ibush, 24, comes from a minority Ashkali community.  His wife is a housewife and stay-at-home mother, taking care of their child and the home. Although Ibush works hard, they are very poor. In order to earn a living, he transports goods and materials for others for fee. 

He is now requesting a loan from KosInvest in order to purchase a horse carriage to help him to transport the goods and to renovate his stable. He is hoping that in the future he will be able to add an additional horse and improve the living conditions and quality of life for his family. He hopes that his children will have a better education and opportunities and wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase a horse carriage to help him to transport goods.

loans.name: Alonso's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est créé le 16 mai  2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte actuellement des femmes qui en plus de vivre ensemble dans le même village, gagnent en expérience dans leur activité respective car comprenant de mieux en mieux le programme cela favorisé par le fait que le village habite un grand « Louma » marché hebdomadaire. La solidarité et entre aide caractérisent les relations entre membre du groupe qui ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Alanso (debout  à l’extrême droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont deux  garçons et deux filles âgés de 09 à 26 ans. C’est une dame très active dans le banc villageois. Elle tient une table de légumes et condiments au marché de la commune. Elle se procure les légumes au marché régional du sud pour les revendre en détail par tas ou mesure selon les besoins du client.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter de l’ognon et des pommes de terre au moins deux sacs de 20 Kg pour chaque produit et divers assaisonnements.

 Avec les bénéfices, elle compte participer très activement à la gestion des charges familiales d’une part et d’autre part accroître son épargne.
texts.en:
The group was created May 16, 2011 during the inauguration of their "banc villageois" loan association. It currently comprises women who not only live together in the same village, but also acquire experience in their respective activities as they gain deeper understanding of the program, encouraged by the fact that the village is host to a big " Louma " weekly market. Solidarity and mutual help characterize the relationship between group members, whose main activity is small trade.

Madame Alanso (standing on the far right with a raised hand) is the group's featured borrower. She is married and the mother of four children, two boys and two girls aged 9 to 26 years. This lady is very active in the "banc villageois".

She holds a stand of vegetables and condiments at the town market. She purchases vegetables at the southern regional market for retail sales,  by lot or in measured quantities, depending on the customer's needs.

With her new loan, she will buy onions and potatoes - at least two 20-kg bags of each product - and various seasonings..

With the profits, she intends to actively participate in managing family responsibilities and also increase her savings.

loans.use: buy onions and potatoes - at least two 20-kg bags of each product - and various seasonings.

loans.name: Astou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 22 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 24 octobre 2012. Il est composé des membres qui vivent dans la même localité et dans les villages environnants. Les membres entretiennent de très bonnes relations et sont solidaire. La plupart s'investit dans le commerce.
Marème, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 28 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants dont 01 garçon. Elle s'investit dans le commerce de denrées alimentaires. Elle achète 30 Kg d'arachide à 400 F le Kg qu'elle revend à 500 F le Kg, 100 Kg de mil à 200 F le Kg revendu à 250 F le Kg, 50 Kg de niébé à 400 F revendu à 500 F le Kg. En parallèle elle confectionne des nappes et torchons qu'elle envie vendre à la capitale à 3000 F la pièce.
Les bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer son épargne. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion du foyer et subvient à ses propres besoins. Mais la majeur partie de ses bénéfices servent à renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group of 22 people makes up a part of the banc villageois established on 24 October 2012. It is made up of members who live in the same area and surrounding villages. They get along and support each other. Most of the group engages in commerce.

Marème, standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is 28 years old. She is married and a mother of two children, one of whom is a boy. 

Marème selle foodstuffs. [With her loan] she is going to buy 30 kilograms of groundnuts at 400 francs a kilogram, which she will resell at 500 francs a kilogram; 100 kilograms of millet at 200 francs a kilogram, which she will resell at 250 francs a kilogram; 50 kilograms of black-eyed peas at 400 francs a kilogram, which she will resell at 500 francs a kilogram. Additionally, she makes tablecloths and tea towels that she would like to sell at 3,000 francs each.

Marème helps her husband with the household expenses and her own needs. But a major part of her earnings will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy millet, black-eyed peas, and groundnuts

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita owns and manages a retail store selling a variety of fruits in the market for a living. She has been doing this for many years, earning well for the family, and she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. 

Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase more fruits to resell in order to gain more income. She plans to expand her business and use her generated income to repair her house in order to create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to resell.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 38 años, está casada con Ronaldo y tiene 2 hijos que viven con ella en su casa hecha a base de madera. Posee un negocio dedicado a la venta de productos comestibles de primera necesidad en un cómodo local con vista a la calle de su vivienda. Se dedica a su negocio hace más de 5 años y desde sus inicios ha  logrado convertirlo en una buena fuente de ingresos para su hogar apoyando a su esposo quien se desempeña como trabajador independiente. Le agradada mantener su negocio siempre bien abastecido porque considera que motiva a la concurrencia de mayor clientela. Considera su oficio como muy adecuado para su capacidad laboral ya que se caracteriza por ser una persona muy alegre y acomedida logrando también convertirse en una vecina querida y conocida. Uno de sus objetivos  a largo plazo es de mejorar su negocio partiendo de la construcción de su vivienda con material noble esperando también mejorar su calida de vida. Es el segundo préstamo que solicita a Kiva y agradece por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que desea seguir contando con la confianza necesaria.  Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería al por mayor como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros.
texts.en:
Sonia is 38 years old. She is married to Ronaldo and has 2 children who live with her in her house made of wood. She has a business where she sells basic food goods. She sells from a convenient location in her house which faces the street. 

She has been doing this business for more than 5 years and right from the beginning it became a good source of money for their household, supporting her husband who works as an independent worker. She likes keeping her store well-stocked, she feels that is the reason she has many customers. She considers her work as very adequate for her personality as she is a very happy and accommodating person. She has also become a well-known and liked neighbor.  

One of Sonia's long term goals is to improve her business by building her house out of solid materials hoping to also improve her quality of life. This is the second loan she has requested from Kiva and she is grateful for the opportunity being offered to her and to be able to count on this support. At this time she is requesting 2,000 PEN to buy merchandise wholesale like rice, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Grezil

texts.en: Ma. Grezil has been operating a general store selling grocery goods in the local community for years earning well for the family. She used her previous loan from GDMPC to add to her inventory capital and she successfully repaid it. Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to buy more grocery goods to resell in order to boost her grocery store. She is hopeful she will gain more profit to save more for the future of her entire family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Jim

texts.en: Jim is operating a business providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for eleven years earning well for the family. He was able to repay his previous loan successfully where he used it in repairing his vehicle. To improve his services, Jim borrowed a new loan recently from GDMPC to buy new tires in order to improve his services. Jim is hopeful that he will gain more returns and use them for their living.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Jeneveb

texts.en: Jeneveb vends dried fish in the market for a living. She has been doing this for more than nine years earning well for the family. She was able to repay her previous loan from GDMPC successfully. She used her previous loan to improve her business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase more dried fish to resell. She is hopeful that she will gain more profit from her business. Jeneveb wants to improve the general living situation of her entire family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to resell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Marilyn is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her videoke machine.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her videoke machine

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru: Венере 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 сына. У Венеры - высшее образование, она работает в местной школе преподавателем кыргызского языка, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Венера занимается животноводством, стартовав 7 лет назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Венеры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова с теленком, 4 овцы и 10 коз. Ежемесячный доход составляет 19,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Венера обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку ягнят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Венера планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение сына.
texts.en: Venera is 50 years old and she is married with one son.  She has a high school education and she works as a Kyrgyz language teacher at the local school.  As an additional source of income for her family, Venera raises livestock.  She started this business seven years ago with the purchase of livestock for 8,000 som KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, her farm now has one dairy cow with a calf, four sheep and ten goats.  Her monthly income is 19,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, Venera has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to by lambs to increase her head of livestock.  She plans to use the income from this to further increase her head of livestock and to save up money for her son's education.

loans.use: to buy lambs

loans.name: Dana Cefy

texts.es:
Dana se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer pujante y activa, una madre y esposa ejemplar. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a realizar capacitaciones sobre belleza y actualmente está generando recursos económicos como estilista independiente, pues tiene su propia sala de belleza en la que trabaja sola todos los días; así logra aportar a la economía del hogar y además paga sus estudios de actualización que realiza permanentemente.
El dinero del crédito que solicita, será invertido en la compra de insumos al por mayor (tratamientos capilares, tinturas, shampoo y acondicionador, entre otros)  para terminar de cancelar sus cursos de actualización en temas de belleza; esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad de inventario para prestar un servicio más ágil y con productos de excelente calidad, además podrá estar a la vanguardia con respecto a los nuevos looks que se utilizan para ofrecer versatilidad y nuevos estilos a sus clientes; lo que será un factor diferenciador.
Dana tiene como propósito a corto plazo, la acreditación y fortalecimiento de su negocio, para que le permita generar una estabilidad económica que le ayude a solventar los gastos básicos del hogar y así mejorar la calidad de vida de los que ama.
texts.en:
Dana is characterized as an active and energetic woman, an exemplary mother and wife. During her working life, she has made a living doing beauty trainings, and she is currently generating an income as an independent stylist. She has her own beauty salon where she works every day. In this way, she is able to contribute to the budget of her home and pay for the refresher courses that she continuously participates in.

The money from the loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of wholesale supplies (hair treatments, hair dyes, shampoo, conditioner, and more) in order to finish paying off her refresher course on beauty topics. This will allow her to have the inventory available to offer more flexible services and excellent quality products. She will also be able to be at the cutting edge with respect to the new looks that are being used, so she can offer versatility and new styles to her customers, which will be a differentiating factor.

Dana has the short-term aim of accrediting and strengthening her business, which will allow her to generate economic stability, which in turn will help her to cover basic home expenses and thus improve the quality of life of those that she loves.

loans.use: To buy wholesale supplies (hair treatments, hair dye, shampoo, conditioner, and more) in order to finish paying for her refresher courses on beauty topics

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina, who is a 30-year-old divorced woman, lives in Gardabani district. She has an 18-year-old student daughter and a mother, who works as a cleaner and earns 300 GEL each month. Antonina married at an early age and wasn’t able to get an education so she has no university degree. 

Antonia has just started a trading business. Antonina goes to Turkey and purchases the products at wholesale prices and then resells them among her friends and villagers. She established her current business and is working hard on developing it to meet her customers' needs and requests. For this reason, she is obtaining a loan from Kiva partner Credo, to increase her business merchandise. She hopes that in the future she'll be capable of opening a clothing store. Antonina is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: to have money for working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Kiran Shehzadi

texts.en:
Kiran Shehzadi is a 34-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband, a daughter, and a son in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Since 2007, her husband has had a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. His wife, Kiran Shehzadi, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of goods for his general store to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children.

Kiran Shehzadi and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods for her general store.

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela, age 48, is from the village of Lisi. She lives with her husband, daughter, son, daughter-in-law, two grandchildren and retired mother-in-law. Lela’s husband has chronic health problems and gets small-sized assistance from the local government. Her daughter is employed at the local kindergarten as a nurse and her son is a security guard.
 
In order to generate a stable monthly income on her own, Lela decided to start a grocery store in her village and sell various food products. She has already rented a store and now requests a loan to buy construction materials for renovation. She will also buy merchandise such as meat and dairy products, oil, pasta, rice and other products. Lela will work as a salesperson and serve her clients in a friendly way. The family will earn a monthly income and they will be able to cover household expenses as well as improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to start up a grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Keshari

texts.en:
Keshari is 49 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 25 and 26. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Keshari plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called "pasal," are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, produce, and shrewd businesswomen. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Santos Francisco

texts.es:
Santos es un señor de 48 años de edad,  casado y tiene 1 hijo; viven en Sololá. El se dedica a confecciones y estampado (serigrafía) de cualquier prenda de vestir (casual o deportiva). Esto lo realiza por pedido de sus clientes y también confecciona prendas para la venta a todo público. El tiene 15 años de trabajar en esta labor. Se decidió por trabajar en esto porque desde muy pequeño ha sido sastre y posteriormente ha adquirido otros conocimientos en estampado. Cuenta Santos que su negocio tiene mucha demanda y buenos precios, con lo cual el obtiene los recursos económicos que su familia necesita para su sostenimiento. Los productos que el elabora los vende en el mercado local de su comunidad.
Además de esta actividad el se dedica a la venta de ropa típica, especialmente para mujeres.
El solicita un préstamo de Q.5,000.00 para compra de telas.
Su sueño más importante es hacer crecer su negocio y convertirlo en un futuro en una empresa formal.
texts.en: Santos is a 48 year old man who is married and has one child. They live in Sololá. He works making clothing and printing (screen-printing) any type of clothing (casual or sports). He does this on request from his clients and also makes clothing to sell to the general public. He has 15 years experience doing this. He decided to work in this field as since he was very young he has worked sewing and later he learned about screen-printing. Santos says that his business has a lot of demand and has good prices with which he can obtain the financial resources he needs to sustain his family. The products he makes he sells in the local market in his community. Besides this activity he sells traditional clothing, especially for women. Santos is requesting a loan of 5,000 GTQ to buy fabric. His greatest dream is to expand his business and in the future make it a formal company.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзона трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Фарзона решила организовать свой новый бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Она будет предоставлять услуги портнихи у себя дома. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Фарзона в будущем мечтает открыть свой швейный цех. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Farzona is a hard-working and cheerful woman.  She is not married and she lives with her parents.  Farzona decided to start a new business sewing women's clothing.  She will offer her services as a seamstress from her home.  With that goal in mind, she enrolled in the "Get Ahead" course offered by the Association of Businesswomen and received a certificate.  Farzona dreams of opening her own tailoring shop in the future.  She is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy a sewing machine.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to start her new business

loans.name: The

texts.en:
The is 31 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She lives with her husband and two children in a rural area of Kampong Thom province, where local people commonly grow rice, cassavas and other seasonal crops to earn a living. The has learned to do farming from her parents and has been involved in this for almost 14 years. Farming is the important source of her family’s income.

The has heard about the water loan program offered by HKL with a special rate, so she would like to borrow this loan to build a safe latrine for the household. This loan will enable her to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment. She expresses her thanks in advance to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine for the household.

loans.name: Risolatkhon

texts.ru: Рисолатхон трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина. Она родилась в 1970 году. Рисолатхон замужем и имеет 3 детей. Ее муж работает охранником. Он получает маленькую зарплату. Рисолатхон хочет организовать свой бизнес купле продажей риса на местном рынке. Она участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она участвовала на этом курсе и получила много позитива для себя. После завершения курса она получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3500 сомони для покупки риса. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Risolatkhon is a hard-working and cheerful woman.  She was born in 1970 and she is married with three children.  Her husband is a security guard and receives a small salary.  Risolatkhon wants to start her own business buying and selling rice at the local market.  She enrolled in the "Get Ahead" course offered by the Association of Business woman and did well for herself.  After the finished the course, she received a certificate.  She is asking for a loan of 3,500 somoni to buy rice.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy rice to start her new business

loans.name: Maguette's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 24 membres dynamiques et solidaires qui font comme activités le commerce et l'embouche. Fatou Ndia, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 65 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 02 garçons. Son activité principale est le commerce de jus de fruit local à base de fleur d'oseille et de pain de singe. Elle achète des fleurs d'oseilles, du sucre, du pain de singe. Elle fait cette activité depuis plus de cinq ans. l'activité est saturé, c'est pourquoi les retombées ne sont pas fameuses, elle vend dans une école. Avec les bénéfices qu'elle génère, elle renforce son épargne et appuis pour la nourriture de la famille.
texts.en:
This group consists of 24 members who are dynamic and share a bond of solidarity. Their activities revolve around commerce and animal fattening. 

Fatou Ndiaye, age 65, is the group member standing on the right and raising her hand. She is the married mother of seven children, two of them boys. Her main activity is the sale of a local fruit juice made from sorrel and pain de singe (fruit of the baobab tree). She buys sorrel, sugar and pain de singe to prepare the juice that she sells in a school. She has been doing this for over five years, but this activity is now saturated, and the profits are less than satisfactory. 

She plans to use her profits to bolster her savings and to buy food for her family.

loans.use: to buy dried sorrel leaves, sugar and pain de singe to make juice for sale.

loans.name: Shoista

texts.ru: Шоиста трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1984 году. Она разведена и имеет одного сына. После развода она вернулась в родительский дом. Для того, чтобы прокормить себя и своего ребенка, она решила заниматься бизнесом. Шоиста один месяц назад начала свой бизнес купле продажей сумок. Она торгует на местном рынке. Шоиста хочет пополнить свой оборотный капитал и с такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки сумок для пополнения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shoista is a hard-working woman.  She was born in 1984 and she is divorced with one son.  After her divorce, she moved back in with her parents.  To be able to provide for herself and her son, Shoista decided to get into business.  She started her business buying and selling handbags one month ago, selling at the local market.  Shoista wants to increase her working capital and with that goal in mind, she has asked for a loan of $3,000 USD to buy handbags.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy bags to increase the working capital of her new business

loans.name: Diarra's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de de 25 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 22 octobre 2012. Il est composé des membres qui habitent le même village et les villages environnants. Les membres vivent dans la bonne entente et sont solidaire. Leur principale activité est le commerce.
Eugué, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un garçon. Sa principale activité est le commerce de légumes. Elle achète des légumes pour une valeur de 30 000 F et les revend au marché de sa localité durant les deux semaines qui suivent et réalise ainsi un bénéfice de 10 000 à 15 000 F. Elle refait ce processus dès écoulement de son stock de marchandises.
Les bénéfices lui permettent de s'acquitter de son épargne dans le banc villageois. Elle souhaitent s'agrandir et acheter un stock beaucoup plus consistant.
texts.en:
This group of 25 people makes up a part of the banc villageois established on 22 October 2012. It is made up of members who live in the same area and surrounding villages. They get along and support each other. Most of the group engages in commerce.

Eugué, standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is 49 years old. She is married and a mother of a son. 

Eugué sells vegetables. She buys the vegetables at 30,000 francs and resells them at a local market during the following two weeks, earning her a profit of 10,000 to 15,000 francs. She repeats this process after she sells all her goods.

Earnings allow her to leave her savings in the banc villageois.

Eugué would like to buy a larger stock that is more consistent.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.ru: Зайнура порядочная и добрая женщина. Она не замужем и не имеет детей. Зайнура решила помочь родителям для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес шитьем женской одежды, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zaynura is a kind and organized woman.  She is single and does not have children.  Zaynura has decided to help her parents for the good of her family.  With that goal in mind, she enrolled in the "Get Ahead" course offered by the Association of Businesswomen and received a certificate.  Now she is fully capable of starting her own business and becoming successful.  She wants to start a business sewing women's clothes, as she has experience in this type of work.  She is asking for a loan of 1,500 somoni to buy a sewing machine to start her new business.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to start her new business

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina sells dried fish in the market for a living. She has been doing this for more than a year and she earns well to aid her husband's income. 

She borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy more dried fish to sell. She is hopeful of gaining more profit, to use it for a better living of the family and she wants to improve her business to have a stable income for their future.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina owns and operates a cafeteria to make a living. After more than nine years in the business, Gina earns well for the family and was able to repay her previous loan from GDMPC successfully. She used her previous loan in improving her business. 

Gina wants to invest more in her business, and without hesitation, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more ingredients for this season. 

Hopefully enough to gain more profit to improve their living.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en:
Celedonia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Celedonia earns more income from selling electronic mobile load.

She is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business. Celedonia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 59-years-old and has two children. Clarita is married and has two children who are in school.

Clarita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Clarita requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Clarita has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Clarita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Neneth is 52 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Neneth has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requests a 7000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, bananas, and cooking oil for her business.

Neneth has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure a future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, bananas, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Crema

texts.en:
Crema works hard to support her family. Crema is married and has a business selling souvenir items in the Philippines.

Crema requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional souvenir items to sell.

Crema has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Crema would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional souvenir items to sell

loans.name: Jennibe

texts.en:
Jennibe is a married woman with four children. Jennibe has a pig fattening business in the Philippines; she is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 28 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Jennibe requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs.

Jennibe has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Jennibe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es:
Carmen es una joven emprendedora de 22 años de edad, madre de un hijo de 2 años y convive en unión libre con su compañero sentimental.
Con el fin de generar recursos económicos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga y los gastos familiares, comenzó a vender mercancía y accesorios de bisutería que ella misma fabrica; trabaja sola todos los días y cuenta con la ventaja de generar recursos sin descuidar a su pequeño hijo.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de insumos para elaborar accesorios como collares, aretes, anillos y pulseras, además requiere comprar calzado para comercializar; así estará preparada para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada decembrina, generándole mejores ganancias para el sustento de su familia.
Carmen, con su espíritu de superación y su dinamismo manifiesta que desea seguir luchando para llegar a cumplir el sueño de montar su propio almacén de ropa, calzado y accesorios, ubicado en el barrio donde reside y además tiene como proyecto a corto plazo, aprender a elaborar nuevas artesanías para así diversificar su mercado objetivo y lograr mejores ventas; que darán como resultado una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para ella y los que ama.
texts.en:
Carmen is a young 22-year-old entrepreneur. She has a two-year-old and is in a common-law marriage.
With the goal of generating economic resources to support her husband with the household costs, she started selling merchandise and jewelry accessories that she makes. She works alone every day and counts on the fact that she can generate an income without having to stop taking care of her small child.
She will invest this loan in the purchase of supplies for making accessories such as necklaces, earrings, rings, and bracelets. She also wants to buy shoes to sell. This way, she will be prepared to satisfy the increasing December demand and generate a greater income for her family.
Carmen, with her spirit of accomplishment and her dynamism, tells us that she wants to keep fighting to reach her dream of opening her own clothing, shoe, and accessory store in her neighbourhood. As a short-term goal, she wants to learn to make new crafts in order to diversify her market and obtain greater sales. As a result, she and those she loves will have a better quality of life and greater well-being.

loans.use: to make supplies for making accessories like necklaces, earrings, rings, and bracelets. She also needs to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is 58 years old and she lives with her husband in the village Udzhanis in Syunik region. She works at the poultry factory. They have three daughters, who are married and they all live separately with their families. 

For 20 years, Anush and her husband have been engaged in farming. On their farm they have a cow, a bull and chickens. The amount of milk and eggs that they manage to sell is very little and the income as well. Anush asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy two calves and fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two calves and fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat is 43 years old, from the village of Tkhilnari. Marat lives with his retired father. Marat runs small-scale agricultural business and grows citrus in his garden. He sells his harvest seasonally to earn a small income.

In order to generate monthly funds, Marat is going to start a transportation service business. If Marat’s loan is raised on Kiva's web site, he plans to purchase a car and transport a variety of goods, depending on the needs and requests of his customers.

Marat will earn additional income and increase the family funds. Marat hopes that his initiative will be lucrative and that he will be able to improve his standard of living in future.

loans.use: to buy a car and transport goods

loans.name: Juliet Tatiana

texts.es:
Juliet es una mujer emprendedora de 28 años de edad, madre de una hija de 8 años y convive con su compañero sentimental en unión libre. 
Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado en diferentes empresas de comestibles y distribuidoras de alimentos como ejecutiva comercial tienda a tienda, razón por la cual posee experiencia y conocimientos en el manejo de este tipo de negocios; pero, ya cansada de trabajar en la calle y con el ánimo de pasar más tiempo con su hija, decidió emprender su propia tienda de abarrotes, para lo cual ya posee un local ubicado en la unidad residencial donde vive; por ello se anima a solicitar el crédito que será invertido en la compra de activos fijos y enseres (nevera, enfriador, estanterías, vitrinas, entre otros) y surtido al por mayor (granos, pastas, chocolate, azúcar, mecato, gaseosas, entre otros productos de la canasta familiar), esto le permitirá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo con el que espera generar un buen impacto en el sector para que le genere una rentabilidad favorable y así lograr cumplir el sueño de posicionarse en el mercado y, con su empuje y ambición se proyecta en un futuro a mediano plazo comprando el local que arrienda actualmente y además abrir otra sucursal en otra unidad residencial. Esto le dará la posibilidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia y para dar a su hija una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Juliet is an enterprising 28-year-old woman. She has one 8-year-old daughter and is in a common-law marriage.
During her productive life, she has worked for various food businesses and distributors as a commercial executive, store-to-store. For this reason, she has experience and knowledge in managing this type of business. However, she is tired of working store-to-store, and wants to spend more time with her daughter. She has decided to open her own grocery store, and already has a storefront in her building of residence.
For her business, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of immovables and basic tools (fridge, freezer, shelves, display case, and others) and wholesale stock (grains, pastas, chocolate, sugar, pastries, pop, and other grocery items). This will allow her to start her business. She hopes to have a good impact on the sector and to generate good profitability. This will reach her goal of being positioned in the market. With her drive and ambition, she expects in the near future to buy her storefront (she is currently renting it) and to open another branch in another residential unit. This will allow her the possibility of improving her family's living conditions and allow her to give her daughter a better education.

loans.use: to buy immovables and basic tools (fridge, freezer, shelving, display cases, and other items) and wholesale stock (grains, pasta, chocolate, sugar, pastries, pop, and other grocery items).

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is 41 years old. She is married, with two children, and she lives in the village of Zegaani. Lali’s husband works as a tractor driver at the local factory and he gets a small, monthly salary. The family lives below the poverty line and gets small-sized social assistance from the government.

Several times, Lali requested loans from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected all the time because of her low income and her poor living conditions. 

Lali requested a loan from Credo to start an agricultural business. Her loan request was approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. With the received credit, Lali will build a cattle shed and purchase calves. 

After purchasing livestock, she will raise them and sell them in the spring, for a higher price. It will generate an income and the new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves and build a cattle shed.

loans.name: Clemente Manuel

texts.es:
Clemente es un campesino dedicado a realizar las actividades del campo, se desempeña como agricultor y de manera alterna, también genera ingresos con la cría y comercialización de cerdos; tanto la cosecha que recolecta, como los cerdos son vendidos en el mercado del pueblo donde reside y así logra percibir recursos para solventar los gastos familiares.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio porcino, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar lechones y concentrado al por mayor para alimentar los animales, esto le permitirá aumentar su capacidad de producción y obtener mejores ganancias por ventas, especialmente en esta temporada decembrina, en la que el consumo de este tipo de carne se incrementa.
Clemente, con su empuje, carisma y pasión por su labor, desea continuar luchando para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, por ello manifiesta que seguirá trabajando arduamente para lograr un mejor desempeño, lo que para él significa mejorar el bienestar y la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Clement is a farmer who works on the land. He works as a farmer part-time. He also earns income by raising and selling pigs. The crops he harvests and the pigs he sells in the town market where he lives provide him with the resources to pay family expenses.

In the hopes of strengthening his pig business, he is requesting a loan to buy piglets and wholesale animal feed for his animals. This will allow him to increase his production capacity and earn more income from sales, especially in December, when meat consumption increases.

With Clemente's initiative, charisma, and passion for his work, wants to keep working to improve his family's quality of life. In order to do this, he will keep working hard to perform better, which will mean a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy piglets and wholesale animal feed for his animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar-charging set, and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Patience's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of 4 members who are all women. All of them have different lines of work. Patience is the leader of this group. She is 22 years old, married, and has two children who are 2 and 4 years of age.	

Patience earns a living by selling biscuits, toffees and chocolate drinks. She sells her products from house to house in Accra. This will be her fifth loan as part of the group and she will use it to purchase more biscuits, toffees and chocolate drinks from wholesalers and thus keep her business well stocked.
Patience is requesting this loan in order to increase her merchandise. Patience faces various challenges in her business, such as competition, and she will use the benefits of the loan to continue purchasing merchandise and earn more income.

Patience is grateful for this opportunity, both for herself and the fellow group members, as many of them are the sole providers for their families.

loans.use: to purchase more biscuits, toffees and chocolate drinks from wholesalers and thus keep her business well stocked.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine is a member of this group and lives in Teshie. She is 38-years-old and married to Samuel, who is a driver. Together they have two children, all are in school. 

Josephine has been in the business of selling cooking utensils for 12 years. She is on her sixth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. With the loan she obtains, she will increase her business capital and purchase more cooking utensils to resell, in order to increase her profits.

Together with two others, they will need a total amount of GHS 2,600 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: purchase more cooking utensils to resell

loans.name: Maria Idalia

texts.es:
Doña María Idalia tiene 36 años de edad, es agricultora y ama de casa, casada y no tiene hijos. Por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que los ingresos percibidos no eran los necesarios para poder ayudar a que ella estudiara. Fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad ya que no pudieron darle la oportunidad de estudiar enseñándole las técnicas necesarias y los procesos que conllevan a su crecimiento y desarrollo. Su apoyo para el desarrollo de campo es su esposo ya que él también es agricultor desde muy joven a al igual que ella. El café es su especialidad y único medio de ingreso teniendo sus terrenos cultivados muy cerca de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando junto a su esposo. Sus planes para el futuro poder cultivar más parcelas de café, mejorar su casa de habitación instalando energía eléctrica en ella por medio de un panel solar o cableado eléctrico por parte de un proyecto que está muy cerca de su casa de habitación.
Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento buscando lograr y mejorar sus cultivos de café comprando fertilizantes, abono, foliares y dando una limpieza a sus cultivos para que tengan un mejor desarrollo y protección de plagas, bichos entre otros.
texts.en:
Maria Idalia is 36 years old, a farmer, and housewife.  She is married and has no children.  She did not have the chance to go to school because her parents were not able to support her because their income was too low.  It was her parents who taught her to work the land at a very early age, since they were not able to provide her the opportunity to attend school.  They taught her the methods and techniques that contributed to her growth and development.  Her support to develop the field comes from her husband who is also a farmer and has been since he was very young, just like her.  They specialize in coffee and this is their only source of income, with their farmland being near their home and she walks there with her husband.  Her plans for the future are to raise more parcels of coffee, improve her home by installing electricity via solar panel or cabling as part of a project near her home.

She is asking for a loan so she can improve her coffee crops by buying fertilizers, seedlings, and weeding her fields so that they will develop better and be protected from disease, vermin and other things.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra is 36 years-old. She is married and has one child, aged 8.  Many years ago, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Sumitra plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys grocery inventory.

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Kanchi is 48 years-old. She is married and has two children, age 25 and 18.  

Many years ago, she established  her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. 

In the future, Kanchi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.
 
Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a 58-year-old woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is married and her husband is a fisherman. This has been their business for a long time now. As her husband fishes, she also sells whatever he catches in the neighborhood and in the market. She supports the needs of their fishing business by ensuring that the necessary tools that he needs are always available. 

She is asking for a loan to buy a new and sturdy fishing net and fuel for the boat. Once this has been taken care of, her husband will be able to fish on a daily basis and her old fish net can be replaced. Her income provides food for them. In the future, she hopes to continue to expand their business for a better income.

loans.use: to buy fish net and fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room and purchase cement, iron, and cinder blocks.

loans.name: Almardon

texts.ru: Алмардон 54-летний житель района Шахритус. Он фермер и занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственной культуры. Алмардон женат, имеет детей. Он сейчас начинает новый бизнес по выращиванию крупнорогатого скота для дальнейшей продажи. Сам климат и природа района благоприятная для ведения данной деятельности. В связи с этим Алмардон просит кредит, чтобы купить трех голов крупнорогатого скота. Он будет держать скот во дворе дома в сарае, и уже запасся кормом для скота. Алмардон действительно нуждается в данном кредите и надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Almardon is 54 years old and lives in the Shahrituz region.  He is a farmer who grows crops, and he is also married with children.  He is now starting a new business raising livestock for resale.  The climate and natural surroundings in his region are good for this kind of work.  For this reason, Almardon is asking for a loan to buy three cows.  He will keep the cows in a barn at his home and he already has enough feed for them.  Almardon definitely needs this loan and he is counting on your support.

loans.use: to buy three cows

loans.name: Ahliddin

texts.ru: Ахлиддин женатый молодой человек в возрасте 26 лет. Он проживает в районе Кубадиён. Ахлиддин энергичный и деятельный человек. Сейчас он решил открыть свой бизнес по купле и продаже крупнорогатого скота. У него имеется место для выращивания и содержания скота и он уже создал свой мини бизнес-план. Ахлиддин планирует выращивать скот в течение 30-35 дней и после продавать с наценкой на местном скотном рынке. Для реализации своих намеченных целей Ахлиддин просит кредит, так как собственных средств не хватает. Ахлиддин позитивно настроен и уже сейчас он верит в успех нового бизнеса.
texts.en: Ahliddin is a married young man, aged 26, who lives in the Qubadiyon region.  He is energetic and dedicated, and how he has decided to start his own business buying and selling livestock.  He has space in which to breed and keep them and he has already written his own mini business plan.  Ahliddin plans to breed livestock in 30-35 days and then sell them on for a profit at the local animal market.  To help realize this plan, Ahliddin has asked for a loan, as his own funds are not sufficient.  He has a positive attitude and he believes in the success of his new business.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his masters studies in education.

loans.name: Ngeb

texts.en:
Ngeb is a 56-year-old, married woman, who has been blessed with four children. Three of them are employed in the garment sector to financially support the family. 

Since Ngeb was young, her parents taught her all about farm work and, as a result, she is in the business of growing rice and raising pigs to make a livelihood. Her products are harvested and sold into the local markets of her region, in Kampong Thom province. Through her effort, she is able to earn a net profit of USD 4.50 per day, which usually goes for food and other costs of commodities.

Ngeb is currently seeking the support of a loan to purchase a motorcycle, to help her employed children in their transportation needs. Having their own motorcycle will allow them to minimize the costs of taking a motorcycle service. 

For her future plan, Ngeb aims to make her business grow and to expand her rice crop, so that she has enough space to allow a better income for her family to enjoy.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to help her employed children in their transportation needs.

loans.name: Muhtorjon

texts.ru: Мухторчон родился в 1985 году. Он женат и на воспитании имеет одного сына. Мухторчон раньше работал ювелиром. Два месяца назад он начал другой бизнес. Он взял в аренду  автомашину и начал заниматься предоставлением услуги такси. Мухторчон теперь хочет купить эту автомашину. С такой целью он обратился за займом. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 долларов США для покупки автомашины. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muhtorjon was born in 1985 and he is married with one son.  He used to work as a jeweler.  Two months ago, he started his own business; he rented a car and started working as a taxi driver.  Now Muhtorjon wants to buy this car.  With that goal in mind, he has asked for a loan of $2,500 USD to buy the car.  He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a car for his new business

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn, age 45, is an experienced farmer from Rohatil village, in the Bakan district of Pursat. She lives with her spouse and three children, who completely depend on her income and are attending school.  

Sophorn is engaged in growing rice and raising some poultry at home to cover her family's needs. Sophorn and her husband help each other manage their rice farm to ensure high crop yields in each harvest season. They have been in this occupation for nearly 13 years. 

Sophorn will use the loan to build a safe latrine at home in order to improve her family’s sanitation. Their healthiness is her priority. The water loan program offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), with a special interest rate, has helped to encourage Sophorn to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine at home in order to improve her family’s sanitation.

loans.name: Ian

texts.en: Ian is married with two children and runs a general store for a living. A good second source of income for the family is raising pigs. He joined GDMPC recently and requests a loan to purchase additional grocery items to resell. He hopes to increase his income and wants to provide his family with a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items to resell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 51-years-old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lucia has a pig raising business in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucia has been in this business for 18 years. Lucia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 36 years old and married, with two children. With two children currently in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 15,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Gina has been in this business for three years and she sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, cologne, diapers, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, and shampoo. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. Gina is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Gina requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

Gina has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik is 39-years-old and he lives with his nice family at the Aygehovit village in the Tavush region. He is married and he has a daughter. Arayik’s wife works as a nurse at the village policlinics. The main income for the family is the farming and agriculture that Arayik is engaged in. He has a rich orchard where he raises grapes, figs and persimmons. During the last several years, Arayik has become rather skilled in poultry and swine breeding.  He has a lot of regular customers who buy fruits, meat and eggs from his house.  Arayik is a very laborious man and during the summer he goes to the Russian Federation for work abroad in order to somehow enlarge his family's income.

Now Arayik asks a loan of 2,000 US dollars in order to buy several bulls and fodder for his farm cattle and he also wants to repair his vineyard.

loans.use: to buy several bulls and fodder for his farm cattle and he also wants to repair his vineyard.

loans.name: Garegin

texts.en:
Garegin lives in the Ddmashen village in the Gegharkunik region. He is married and he has two school-aged children. Garegin already has one successful deal with Kiva and this will be his second deal. His first loan he used on the purchase of petrol and diesel oil for his business (he used to sell petrol and diesel oil from his garage). But for  this loan, he wants to use it for his farming activities. On his farm he has a cow, calves, sheep, chickens and turkeys. By the help of his wife they sell from their house meat, milk, macun (Armenian national dairy-product) and eggs. 

Garegin asks a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to buy two piglets, a cow and a lot of animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy two piglets, a cow and a lot of animal fodder in order to enlarge his farming

loans.name: Margoth Emilse

texts.es:
Margoth es una mujer emprendedora y activa, a sus 25 años de edad es propietaria de una barbería que comenzó hace 1 año. El oficio lo conoció gracias a su compañero sentimental con quien convive, ya que él se desempeña como barbero; el establecimiento se encuentra ubicado en una calle principal del sector donde reside lo que se convierte en su mayor ventaja, cuenta con 3 empleados que se rotan los horarios de atención que van de lunes a jueves entre 8 am y 8 pm, viernes y sábados de 8 am a 10 pm y los domingos laboran de 10 am a 4 pm; cuentan con muy buena clientela y, adicionalmente dentro del establecimiento, ella también ofrece mercancía para hombres como camisetas, gorras, relojes, entre otros; así es como logra generar los recursos para el sustento familiar.
El crédito que solicita será invertido para comprar 2 sillas de barbería adicionales, ya que contratará otros dos empleados para satisfacer la demanda actual que posee el negocio; esto le permitirá incrementar los ingresos por la prestación del servicio y mejorará la rentabilidad del establecimiento.
Margoth tiene como proyecto a mediano plazo acreditar aún más el negocio actual, para tener la oportunidad de abrir otra sucursal en un local comercial bien ubicado; así tendrá la posibilidad de mejorar la calidad de vida propia y la de sus colaboradores.
texts.en:
Margoth is an enterprising and active woman. At the age of 25, she owns a barbershop which she opened one year ago. She learned the job thanks to her boyfriend, with whom she lives; he is a barber. The shop is located on a main street in the sector where she lives. This is her greatest advantage. She has three employees who rotate their schedules and work Mondays to Thursdays from 8 am to 8 pm, Fridays and Saturdays from 8 am to 10 pm, and Sundays from 10 am to 4 pm. She has a very good clientele and, in her shop, she also offers merchandise for men such as shirts, caps, and watches. This is how she generates an income for her family.
She will invest this loan in the purchase of two barbers' chairs because she is going to hire two more employees in order to satisfy her current demand. This will allow her to increase her income and improve her business profitability. 
As a future goal, Margoth plans to improve her business more in order to have the opportunity to open another branch in a well-located commercial building. This way, she will have the opportunity to improve her quality of life and that of the lives of her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy two barbershop chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis es un joven emprendedor de 24 años de edad, que luego de culminar sus estudios secundarios, decidió capacitarse en el área de sistemas, pues desde pequeño se sintió atraído por este tema, luego de un tiempo y, con la colaboración económica de su padre, inició su propio negocio, un café internet que fue acogido por la comunidad y poco a poco se posicionó en el mercado, allí trabaja todos los días de 10 am a 10 pm, con el paso del tiempo fue ampliando sus servicios con fotocopias, venta de minutos y accesorios para celular, impresiones y venta de artículos de papelería, así ha logrado generar ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales y para pagar sus estudios universitarios.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de una máquina plastificadora, una nevera y surtido de gaseosas y jugos; esto le permitirá ampliar su portafolio y podrá ofrecer un servicio más completo con el que logrará fidelizar su clientela y mejorará los ingresos que percibe por su labor.
Luis tiene como propósito terminar sus estudios universitarios para ser un profesional y, en un futuro a mediano plazo sueña con abrir otro punto de servicio, así podrá mejorar las condiciones de vida y bienestar tanto propio como el de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a young 24-year-old entrepreneur. After finishing his secondary studies, he decided to get training in systems because he has been interested in this subject from a young age. After some time, and with his father's financial support, he started his own business: an internet cafe that has been welcomed by the community and, bit by bit, has become positioned in the market. He works in his cafe every day from 10 am to 10 pm. With the passing of time, he has been increasing his services with photocopiers, phone minutes, cell phone accessories, printers, and stationery. This way, he has been able to generate an income to cover his personal costs and pay for his university studies.
He will invest this loan in the purchase of a laminating machine, a fridge, pop, and games. This will allow him to expand his portfolio and offer a more complete service which will solidify his customer base and improve his income.
Luis plans to finish his university studies and become a professional. In the future, he dreams of opening another service point. This will allow him to improve his living conditions and his well-being, as well as that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a laminating machine, a fridge, pop, and games.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 56-year-old married woman. She has successfully operated a small general store with her son (also shown in the photo). Her son assists her by purchasing items from the wholesale market. She maintains a good customer base and earns enough to contribute to the family income. However, due to the lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requests a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demands. 

She is in her 6th loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She is expecting to boost her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy her own means of transportation (motorcycle).

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan es un señor de 28 años de edad, casado, tiene tres hijos: 2 niñas y un niño actualmente vive junto a su familia en San José Chacayá, Sololá.
El es de oficio albañil, sus ingresos los obtiene con las construcciones que realiza en los diferentes lugares tanto de San José como fuera de ella. El se dedica a esta actividad porque no tiene una formación académica, pero si tiene muchos conocimientos en construcción, por otro lado es una labor que tiene demanda permanente y los ingresos que se obtienen son bastante buenos. Esta actividad le ha permitido a Juan durante 8 años generar los ingresos suficientes para cubrir sus necesidades básicas y las de su familia.
El quiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y por ello está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para compra de cal, cemento y hierro.
El sueño más grande de Juan es mejorar su vivienda, y contar con todos los servicios básicos que le permitan a el y a su familia vivir con dignidad.
texts.en:
Juan is 28, married, and has three children: two girls and a boy.  He and his family currently live in San José Chacayá, in Sololá.  Juan is in construction and makes his income from projects he does in and outside of San José.   He's in this business because he doesn't have academic training but he has quite a bit of knowledge about construction.  In addition, in construction there's always demand and the income is pretty good.  Over the last 8 years this line of work has allowed Juan to make enough to cover basic needs for himself and his family.

Juan wants to improve his house's condition so he's seeking a loan of 5,000GTQ to buy lime, cement and iron.  He's biggest dream is improve his house and have all the basic services for himself and his family to live in dignity.

loans.use: to buy lime, cement and iron.

loans.name: Madelyn Vanessa

texts.es:
Madelyn de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, es soltera, por hoy trabaja como empleada en una ferretería, vive con sus abuelos, ella es una mujer con deseos de superación en la parte de los negocios, de sus ingresos le ayuda a sus abuelos.       


El negocio en el que trabaja, es una ferretería, tiene dos años de experiencia en ventas, un tío de ella es el dueño de la ferretería, la distancia que recorre diario es de quince kilómetros, el horario  es de 8:00 am a 4:00 pm no tiene otra actividad a la que se dedique.


Ella quiere iniciar un negocio propio que es una tienda, debido a eso solicita el crédito para comprar productos de la canasta básica como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, detergentes, golosinas, etc. lo que le permitirá tener una fuente de ingreso propia, ya no tendrá que estar viajando para poder tener sus ingresos.

Su deseo es ir iniciando su negocio poco a poco, ir creciendo las ventas y la tienda, tener una estabilidad para cuando decida formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Madelyn, 20 years old, is studying for her degree.  She is single.  Today she works as an employee in a hardware store.  She lives with her grandparents.  She is a woman with the desire for improvement in matters of business.  Her income helps her grandparents.  She has two years of experience in sales at the hardware store where she works, which is owned by one of her uncles.  The distance that she travels daily is 15 kilometers.  The hours are from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.  She doesn’t work in any other activity.
