She wants to start her own business of a store and because of that she is requesting a loan to purchase some basic staple products like rice, beans, sugar, salt, detergents, snacks, etc., which will allow her to have her own source of income.  She will not have to travel to be able to have income. 

Her desire is to start her business little by little, to increase the sales and the store and to have stability for when she decides to form her own family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, salt, detergents, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate, dressed timber and pine trim, cement, sand, and nails to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy windows for her home.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino, opta por otro crédito para invertir en la compra de dos semovientes para repasto con lo que fortalecerá el negocio.
Con el préstamo anterior compro semovientes los cuales engordo y luego los vendió, aparte de tener buenas ganancias el aumento su ganado, ha cancelado su deuda y mejorado su ambiente familiar.
texts.en: Marcelino is seeking another loan to invest in the purchase of beef cattle so he can strengthen his business.  With his prior loan he bought cattle which he fattened up and sold.  In addition to making a good profit, he increased his herd, paid off his debt and improved his family environment.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY YUNGAQUI,el banco esta ubicado en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

La socia Martha tiene 24 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pescado ,la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicandose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia su negocio ,la socia vende a todos su clientes que le solicitan,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que le socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicta el credito para la compra de pescados para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Senor de Ccoyllority Yungaqui" communal bank, which is located in the Anta district, in the province of Anta, in the department of Cusco.

Martha is 24 years old, married, and has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her fish-selling business. She has been working in this business for a good amount of time and it is going well, thanks to the effort that she puts forth every day. She sells to all customers who seek her products. She is a responsible and diligent person, which is how she moves her family forward.

She requests this loan so that she can purchase fish for her business. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase fish for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia Elizabeth se sigue dedicando al negocio de fisioterapeutica,ella tiene un consulturio,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar su consultorio de fisioterapia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar sillas para su consultorio.

La socia esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Elizabeth continues to work at her physical therapy business. She has a consulting business. She works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. She has 7 years of experience and it is going well. Her dream is to expand her physiotherapy consulting business.

She requests his loan to purchase chairs for her consulting business. She is happy with the loan and she promises to make the payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase chairs for her physical therapy consulting business.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 47 years old and he lives in the village of Geghamavan, which is in Gegharkunik region. Samvel is married and he has a son who has just graduated from his school and is going into the army. 

Samvel is a builder by specialty and, for many years, he worked at different companies. Now, he works at a private company, as a security officer, but Samvel, together with his wife, is also engaged in farming. 

In Armenia, there is a tradition in which, when a young man goes into the army for military service, his family organizes big and cheerful party, inviting all their relatives, friends, and neighbors. The meaning of such a party is to happily see him off to the army and to make him remember all his relatives and friends, during his several years of serving in the army. They wish him safe service and peacefulness for the whole world.

So, Samvel asks for a loan of AMD 400,000 (Armenian drams) in order to organize a nice party for his son, who is going into the army.

loans.use: to organize a nice party for his son, who is going into the army.

loans.name: Bemy

texts.en:
Bemy is 39-years-old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Bemy is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy vitamins, feed and other supplies for her livestock.

Bemy has been raising livestock for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling peanuts.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, feed and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru: Вере, 56 лет, вдова, имеет 3 дочерей. Все дочери взрослые и самостоятельные. После смерти мужа, кормильца семьи в поиске доходов для своей семьи Вера стала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Бизнес начала с 1,000 сом (KGS), 25 лет назад. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Вера достигла небольших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 13 000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Веры имеется: 2 дойные коровы и 1 осел. По хозяйству помогают младшая дочь с зятем. Дочь - домохозяйка, а зять работает мясником. Есть небольшой доход. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Вера обратилась в «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку сена и кормов для скота на зимний период. Доходы от кредита Вера планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего небольшого хозяйства, а также в будущем планирует купить автомашину для своей дочери с зятем.
texts.en: Vera is 56 years old and a widow; she has three daughters, all of whom are grown and live on their own.  After her husband died, Vera took over raising crops and livestock to generate income to feed her family.  She started this business 25 years ago with 1,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her tireless and detailed work, Vera has been quite successful in developing her farm and she now generates a monthly income of 13,000 som (KGS).  Today her farm has two dairy cows and one donkey.  She gets help from her younger daughter, who is a homemaker, and son-in-law, a butcher.  They have a small income.  With the goal of developing her business further, Vera has turned to "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to buy hay and feed for her animals over the winter.  She plans to use the income from this to further improve her farm and she also plans to buy a car for her daughter and son-in-law in the future.

loans.use: to  buy hay and fodder for the winter

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en: Gulnara is 39-years-old. She lives in the village of Alambari with her husband and grown son. Her husband works as a security guard and earns a modest monthly wage. Additionally, the family runs an agrobusiness and sells the harvested citrus, maize and nuts, which are grown on a family-owned plot of land. Nevertheless, they live in poverty because their income is not enough for their three-membered family. Gulnara has requested a loan to start a dairy farm. Her loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The loan will be used for purchasing a milk cow. Gulnara will place the cow in the cattle shed located in her yard and will start selling the milk at the local market. The family's income should increase by 150–200 GEL (Georgian Lari), which is a 40% to 50% increase. The family's living conditions will significantly improve, and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow and start a dairy business

loans.name: Girabagenzi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Asha fait partie du groupe GirabagenziII et habite à Bujumbura. C’est une veuve de 35 ans. Elle a 3 enfants âgés de  6 à 16 ans, tous  étudient.  

Elle fait le commerce de  boutique (haricot, riz, huile de palme) depuis 3  ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (riz, haricot, huile de palme,…)  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait  voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Asha, age 35, is a member of the Girabagenzi II group and she lives in Bujumbura. She is the widowed mother of three children aged 6 to 16 who all go to school.  

She has been a shopkeeper for three years, selling beans, rice, and palm oil. This is her 5th loan cycle with Turame, and she plans to use her credit to stock up on merchandise for her store to bolster her profits. 

In the coming years, she wants to ensure that her children pursue their education.

loans.use: to bolster her working capital and stock up on merchandise for her store (beans, rice, palm oil) to increase her sales and her profits.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en:
Kausar is 44-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Kausar makes enough to provide for her family. 

To fully restock her store, she requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Kausar wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Rihana

texts.en:
Rihana is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been providing the services of home-cooked food for many years.  Rihana enjoys making food and she has become famous in her town for providing this service. She takes orders from nearby hotels and people in her community and earns enough to lead a decent life. Her husband assists her in taking orders from customers and then delivers them to respective places. 

She is a responsible mother of five children and needs to earn more to pay for daily expenditures. Currently, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy stock of rice, flour, oil, and salt at lower rates from the market. In this way, she will be able to increase her sales. Rihana wishes to utilize her earned profit for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, flour, oil, and salt.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 50-year-old, married woman and the mother of four children. 

The man shown in the photo is Perveen’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services, using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. 

For this reason, Perveen has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Perveen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet on his farm.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis, age 45, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals, such as baby goats and sheep, at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market, at higher prices. She makes enough money through her business to contribute to the family's income. 

Nargis needs to improve her business, to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more sheep. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. 

With this loan, Nargis will definitely expand her business and her income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more sheep.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 43-year-old, married woman who has been running business with her husband many years, selling milk. She has two cows which she uses for milk, selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Perveen has become famous for providing good-quality milk and she makes enough money to contribute to her family's income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her seventh loan cycle and she has applied for a loan of PKR 60,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. 

Perveen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a 53-year-old married woman.  She has been running a business selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and sells them out near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries).  She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation.  Currently, she requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase two more calves.  She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of improving her standard of living through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizers to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Bahati Group

texts.en:
Bahati is a Nuru International group of three farmers in the Kuria West District of Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods.They will obtain loans through Nuru International in order to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members of Bahati collectively guarantee the loan.
Josephene pictured with her hand raised is a representative of the group. Josephene is 40 years old and married with seven children. She has been a member of this group for the past three years. This KIVA loan will help her obtain farm inputs for the 2014 long rains season. She believes these inputs will increase her farm yields. Josephene, just like other members of her group, will take input loans for one acre where she will grow maize on one-half acre and sorghum and millet on a quarter-acre each. She will use the harvest to secure food for her family and then sell the surplus in order to invest in another business to diversify the income base for her family.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 42-year-old married lady. She has had a hand embroidery business for six years. Her designs are very much in demand and she contributes to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she requests a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy spools of thread in various colors and packs of decorative beads, sequins and stones. These purchases will enable her to consistently cater to more customers. She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers. 

She is in the 4th loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in various colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 36-year-old married woman who has operated a fabric business for many years. She purchases a variety of fabric from the main city and then sells them to the people in her area. She is known for selling good quality fabrics.  Musarat requests a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different fabric for the winter season.  She understands her customer's preferences and tastes. The increased stock of fabric will enable her to sell more and therefore earn more income. 

She is in her 6th loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different fabric for the winter season.

loans.name: Nyankiringiti Group

texts.en:
This group is part of a Nuru International group of two farmers called Nyakiringiti and is based within the Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

The person raising up his hand in the picture is Joshua. He is 28 years old and married with two children. Joshua has been a member of the group since 2012 and he is the group’s chairperson.

He has been learning better farming methods within his group and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on his farm to grow maize, sorghum and millet during the 2014 long rains seasons.  He is, however, constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable him to purchase these farm inputs. He believes that the use of hybrid seeds and fertilizer will increase his yields and he will not only get enough food for his family, but will also sell the surplus and obtain capital to start a business to supplement his farming income.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Kumuru B Group

texts.en:
This group of three people is a Nuru International group of farmers called Kumuru B. The group is based in Kuria West District. They have come together in order to grow, socially and economically, through agriculture.

Baraka is 24 years old and married, and he has two children. One of the children goes to school. He is a first-time member of the group. He is very excited about joining the group. He believes this will provide a good platform for him to learn better farming methods that will increase his harvest significantly.
 
Baraka will grow sorghum, millet and maize, in a one acre farm, during the 2014 long rains. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from Kiva.  He will buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer with the loan, which is expected to enable him to have a bountiful harvest during the 2014 harvest period. He will secure food for his family and sell the surplus. He will use the money he earns to pay back the loan and to invest in another business.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for growing maize, sorghum and millet
